finding: The rs56746789 variant was identified as one of the variants with PPR > 0.99, suggesting significant replicability. It showed relatively high PPRs for both MAMBA-G (PPR = 0.832) and MAMBA-GT effects (PPR = 0.510). This variant was located in the LINC01482 locus, which is associated with multiple studies linking SNPs to lipid traits.
title: Statistical Assessment of Biomarker Replicability using MAJAR Method

finding: Another SNP, rs11079718 in MAPT, was also found to have age-dependent effects with a significant association (P < 5.14×10^-5) amidst the analyzed signals.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs371185851 at position 17q21.31 showed a highly significant association with the brain BAG, related to the MAPT gene, which is linked to neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's disease, emphasizing its functional relevance in brain aging processes.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Biological Age in Nine Human Organ Systems

finding: This SNP had associations with five deletions and two duplications in moderate LD (R2=0.35-0.67) relevant to the MAPT H1/H2 haplotype, previously identified in various neurodegenerative diseases, suggesting a complex genetic architecture in AD.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: At the TNFRSF13B locus, MultiSuSiE fine-mapped rs34562254 as a missense variant influencing total protein concentration. This variant was not fine-mapped in Afr47k, Eur47k, or Eur94k due to low effect sizes or linkage disequilibrium issues. It was associated with common variable immunodeficiency and has been previously implicated by GWAS.
title: MultiSuSiE improves multi-ancestry fine-mapping in All of Us whole-genome sequencing data

finding: The rs146752602 SNP was associated with an increased risk of developing sarcomas in carriers of the TP53 class C variant R337H. Specifically, the presence of this inactivating variant of the putative tumor suppressor XAF1 (E134*/Glu134Ter) enhanced the cancer risk, suggesting that certain genetic alterations might synergize to elevate the pathogenic potential of class C TP53 variants.
title: Fine resolution clustering of TP53 variants into functional classes predicts cancer risks and spectra among germline variant carriers

finding: The rs1641518 variant near SHBG was noted as a novel finding, revealing its association with lower SHBG levels and reinforcing the understanding of its effects on hormone biology in PCOS.
title: Genomic and proteomic evidence for hormonal and metabolic foundations of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: This variant in <italic>HNF1B</italic> at 17q12 was identified with <italic>P</italic>=2.1 10<sup>−46</sup>, indicating it may affect PSA levels and prostate monitoring.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Tied to the <italic>TP53</italic> gene, this variant displayed relevant associations with prostate cancer, specifically through PSA implications.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This variant reported significant relevance in cancer studies, indicated by its connection to <italic>SMG6</italic> and PSA.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Similarly, rs577915581 showed an RD of 1.00, implying a large risk difference associated with Pompe disease, another severe AR disorder, reaffirming the substantial impact of this variant despite its rarity.
title: Deleterious Variants Contribute Minimal Excess Risk in Large-Scale Testing

finding: The germline variant rs139229826 in the ERN1 gene was identified in 11% of the patient cohort, marking it as a novel finding in glioblastoma research. This variant results in the IRE1 L914M amino acid substitution, a change predicted to impact the protein's RNase activity due to its proximity to a critical catalytic residue.
title: Characterization of the mutational landscape of high-grade gliomas in a Latin American cohort

finding: The rs587778719 variant in TP53 was reported with an allelic frequency of 10.6% and classified as benign. This finding contributed to the identification of multiple TP53 mutations, expanding the mutational landscape of this gene in glioma patients.
title: Characterization of the mutational landscape of high-grade gliomas in a Latin American cohort

finding: The rs2077551 variant on chromosome 17 showed strong associations with brain IDPs, with a total of 174 associations found among the imaging characteristics. This variant was significantly related to changes in white matter integrity as well as morphological measures including cortical thickness. The most notable association involved cortical surface area in the right hemisphere, specifically the fusiform area, suggesting that this genetic locus is also implicated in cortical changes associated with IPF.
title: Mapping brain endophenotypes associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis genetic risk

finding: The rs73332852 in the UBE2G1-SPNS3 locus was found to significantly increase risk for TET2-CH (OR = 1.50 [1.33-1.69], P = 6.69 x 10^-11).
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs12952581 was identified as being 161 kb from the gene ABI3, which is implicated in immune-related processes, specifically linked to eosinophil counts. This finding was part of a broader analysis using the surrogate functional false discovery rate (sfFDR) framework, which significantly enhanced the power of gene discovery in GWAS related to obesity and eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis.
title: Exploiting pleiotropy to enhance variant discovery with functional false discovery rates

finding: Linked to cervical cancer (p=1.2 × 10⁻⁹), this SNP maps to GSDMB, a gene involved in apoptosis, and has been implicated in cervical cancer progression.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP was linked to the delayed recall memory phenotype with a P value of 3.20E-08, situated in an intron of CEP112, which is associated with cognitive function.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease brain imaging biomarkers and neuropsychological phenotypes in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: The SNP rs121912749 in SLC4A1 was associated with cancer progression and tumor cell proliferation. This non-synonymous SNV led to the amino acid change G388R, indicating its potential role in malignancy.
title: A newly identified pathology of Episodic Angioedema with Hypereosinophilia (Gleich’s Syndrome) revealed by Multi-Omics Analysis

finding: Found to harbor significant genes related to thyroid phenotypes, thus contributing to understanding hypothyroidism.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The T-allele of rs117143557, located near MPRIP, was found to have an odds ratio of 17.05 in a Japanese cohort, indicating a strong effect on elite sprinting ability, approaching genome-wide significance (P = 7.63E-08).
title: Multi-phase, multi-ethnic GWAS uncovers putative loci in predisposition to human sprint performance, health and disease

finding: The SNP <italic>rs9895741</italic> demonstrated a discordant effect connected to dark brown hair color, showing a positive association in Europeans (beta=0.104) counter to a negative impact in Central/South Asian populations (beta=-0.194).
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs740516, located in the gene ABCA6, was significantly associated with LDL cholesterol levels in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) with a p-value of 7×10^-9. Furthermore, this SNP was found to correlate with the expression of ABCA6 at a significance level of p=3.3×10^-5. This finding suggested a potential role for ABCA6 in influencing lipid metabolism, although it was noted that ABCA6 itself was not causally associated with lipid traits based on Mendelian randomization analyses.
title: Functional Characterization of Lipid Regulatory Effects of Three Genes Using Knockout Mouse Models

finding: Found at a novel rare AD locus RPL23/LASP1 on chromosome 17, rs1269322417 was linked to genes that exhibited differential expression in neuronal populations and was related to the Alzheimer's disease phenotype.
title: Identification of 16 novel Alzheimer’s disease susceptibility loci using multi-ancestry meta-analyses of clinical Alzheimer’s disease and AD-by-proxy cases from four whole genome sequencing datasets

finding: The rs8070723 SNP, which is part of the MAPT H1 haplotype, was associated with PSP risk, showing an odds ratio of 4.02 and a p-value of 9.89·10^-27, confirming its role in PSP susceptibility.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: An additional independent risk signal within the MAPT locus was identified with rs242557, showing an odds ratio of 0.72 and a p-value of 2.49·10^-04, further supporting the role of MAPT in PSP.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: This SNP (PNMT) maintained significant association with unclassified heart failure in the MVP African American cohort after Bonferroni correction.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: This SNP (SMG6) was replicated in the HF GWAS, supporting its association with heart failure.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: The study identified that the T allele of <italic>MAPT</italic> rs17649553 was associated with better verbal memory performance in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients. Specifically, T-carriers (CT and TT) exhibited verbal memory scores comparable to healthy controls, while CC carriers showed impaired performance. Furthermore, <italic>MAPT</italic> rs17649553 was found to significantly reshape the topology of gray matter covariance and white matter networks, with network metrics correlated with verbal memory. Notably, mediation analysis indicated that the topology of the white matter network, characterized by small-worldness properties, mediated the protective effects of the T allele on verbal memory in PD patients.
title: Effects of MAPT rs17649553 on Structural Network Integrity and Verbal Memory in Parkinson’s Disease

finding: rs199598395 was negatively associated with blood donation and was linked to iron deficiency anemia, impacting hemoglobin levels adversely.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The rs200013015 variant was found to be significantly enriched in patients with Primary Antibody Deficiency (PAD), presenting an odds ratio of 82.12 (CI 9.20-346.93; p=0.0028). Although previously classified as a Variant of Uncertain Significance (VUS) in a patient without an immune-related phenotype, it was later identified in patients with antibody deficiency, indicating a potential correlation with immune-related conditions.
title: Clinical exome sequencing data from patients with inborn errors of immunity: cohort level meta-analysis and the benefit of systematic reanalysis

finding: The SNP rs11078398 found at the RAI1 locus was associated with habitual coffee consumption and supported by previous studies.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: This rare missense variant in the SREBF1 gene was associated with higher total cholesterol (TC) levels, presenting a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.74% and an effect size of beta = 0.0442 (P = 2.8 × 10^-9). The variant was located 372kb from the index GWAS non-coding variant.
title: Exome wide association study for blood lipids in 1,158,017 individuals from diverse populations

finding: The LRRC37A:rs2732703-G variant was noted to interact with APOE ε4 and was associated with increased Alzheimer's disease risk in the American Admixed ancestry.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The rs781278654 variant, corresponding to the mutation c.1483C>T leading to p.R495W in the ATP6V0A1 gene, was identified in one individual among 85 patients with early-onset progressive myoclonus epilepsy (PME) during whole exome sequencing. This variant co-segregated with the clinical phenotype in an Italian family affected by PME with ataxia and showed a low allelic carrier frequency of 0.00001315 in the control population, indicating it may be a rare but significant mutation related to severe developmental and epileptic encephalopathy.
title: Biallelic and de novo variants in ATP6V0A1 cause progressive myoclonus epilepsy and developmental and epileptic encephalopathy

finding: The variant rs4791503, located within the intron of the LINC00670 gene and near the MYOCD gene, showed a highly significant association with inadequate treatment response (ITR) in major depressive disorder (MDD) patients in the Indian cohort, with a p-value of 2.96x10^-7. The minor allele (C) frequency was significantly lower in cases (15.75%) compared to controls (46.59%), resulting in an odds ratio of 0.2144.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: The G allele of rs1801690 was associated with reduced TSH, increased risk of hyperthyroidism, and various phenotypes including increased aspartate aminotransferase levels, increased height, and reduced deep venous thrombosis risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: A missense variant in GSDMA, rs56030650, was identified as influencing DBP concentration with links to inflammatory processes and related diseases.
title: Genetic correlates of vitamin D-binding protein and 25 hydroxyvitamin D in neonatal dried blood spots

finding: At the 17q12 locus, rs12944882's association with ALL was significant (P=7.71 x 10^-10), and this represented a secondary association that has not been noted before.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The rs9913145 SNP in the TSPOAP1 gene was revealed to be significantly associated with executive function in the South Asian population studied. This variant, which has a MAF of 0.15%, was highlighted as the sentinel variant for the gene. Although its CADD score of 1.12 suggested it was not strongly deleterious, this association indicates a potential link to cognitive function specific to South Asians.
title: Region-based analysis with functional annotation identifies genes associated with cognitive function in South Asians from India

finding: The SNP rs4924755 was identified as significant (p<5×10^-8) in the context of abdominal obesity, particularly associated with lower expression levels of 48 adipocyte marker genes in risk allele carriers, including FASN and AGPAT2. It was also linked to the upregulation of genes like PLIN1 and LIPE.
title: Integration of single cell omics with biobank data discovers trans effects of SREBF1 abdominal obesity risk variants on adipocyte expression of more than 100 genes

finding: The SNP rs7224725 was found to be significant (p<5×10^-8) for abdominal obesity and associated with a specific reduction in the expression of certain adipocyte marker genes in risk allele carriers, alongside rs9944423.
title: Integration of single cell omics with biobank data discovers trans effects of SREBF1 abdominal obesity risk variants on adipocyte expression of more than 100 genes

finding: The SNP rs9944423 was significant (p<5×10^-8) for abdominal obesity risk, similar to rs7224725, reflecting a lower expression of various adipocyte genes in carriers.
title: Integration of single cell omics with biobank data discovers trans effects of SREBF1 abdominal obesity risk variants on adipocyte expression of more than 100 genes

finding: The SNP rs35104205 was identified as significant for abdominal obesity (p<5×10^-8) in a broad context, showing effects both in males and females, with a notable impact on adipocyte gene expression.
title: Integration of single cell omics with biobank data discovers trans effects of SREBF1 abdominal obesity risk variants on adipocyte expression of more than 100 genes

finding: The SNP rs12948060 was significant (p<5×10^-8) for abdominal obesity and associated with higher expression of many adipocyte genes in risk allele carriers, strongly indicating its role in adipocyte function.
title: Integration of single cell omics with biobank data discovers trans effects of SREBF1 abdominal obesity risk variants on adipocyte expression of more than 100 genes

finding: The SNP rs4646347 was found to be significant (p<5×10^-8) in relation to abdominal obesity. Its risk allele status correlated with increased expression of adipocyte genes, similar to rs12948060.
title: Integration of single cell omics with biobank data discovers trans effects of SREBF1 abdominal obesity risk variants on adipocyte expression of more than 100 genes

finding: The SNP rs4646346 was identified as significant (p<5×10^-8) for abdominal obesity and showed patterns of increased adipocyte gene expression in risk allele carriers, consistent with the findings for rs12948060 and rs4646347.
title: Integration of single cell omics with biobank data discovers trans effects of SREBF1 abdominal obesity risk variants on adipocyte expression of more than 100 genes

finding: The SNP rs11650272 was identified as an independent eRNA-QTL associated with the BRCA1e eRNA located upstream of the BRCA1 gene.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: The study identified a significant association between the rs1042522 (P72R) SNP of the TP53 gene and prostate cancer risk, specifically in patients with aggressive metastatic cancer. The presence of the P72R SNP was found to be significantly higher in prostate cancer samples compared to the non-cancerous European population, with an odds ratio of 7.937 (95% CI 5.37-11.00), demonstrating that the G allele (R72) was associated with higher Gleason scores (≥8), indicating a link to more aggressive forms of the disease.
title: Association of the rs1042522 SNP with prostate cancer risk: a study of cancer tissues, primary tumor cultures and serum samples from a European Caucasian population

finding: The variant rs62075722 was associated with a recessive effect on retinal thickness measurements, indicating that homozygotes exhibited different retinal thickness compared to heterozygotes. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic influences on retinal morphology.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides informative biomarkers

finding: This SNP was deemed important for the AA GIA group as a predictor associated with progressive supranuclear palsy, illuminating its potential role in dementia risk.
title: Improving genetic risk modeling of dementia from real-world data in underrepresented populations

finding: The nonsynonymous variant rs1804145 on SERPINF1 had the highest C-score indicating its deleterious potential and was significantly associated with SB (p=1.1E-7). This variant suggested a greater genetic risk for SB, linking it to its impact within both the genetic landscape of suicide risk and related traits.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Suicidal Behaviors and Alcohol Use Disorders in an American Indian Population

finding: This intronic SNP within MAPT was associated with neuroprotective effects linked to parietal lobe cortical thickness and retained significance when adjusting for diagnosis, indicating its potential non-direct impact on AD.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: This variant showed P values less than 1.0 x 10^(-5) for associations with any TP53 mutation and LOF TP53 mutations in the discovery analyses.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: The SNP rs3833085 located at 17q25.1 in the TRIM47 gene was confirmed for its association with brain aging traits, presenting a relationship with neurobiological characteristics.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The SNP rs2106786, located in the inversion region on chromosome 17 and associated with the MAPT gene, was found to be highly significant in relation to brain age gap (BAG), with a p-value of 5.4x10^-21 and an effect size indicating an increase of 0.27 years in brain age.
title: Genetic architecture of brain age and its casual relations with brain and mental disorders

finding: The SNP rs2435204 was previously reported in relation to BAG but was indexed differently. In this study, it was also highly significant, further supporting its association with BAG.
title: Genetic architecture of brain age and its casual relations with brain and mental disorders

finding: The SNP rs713522, associated with MAPT, was significantly linked to clusters C0 and C1, further supporting its role in the genetic landscape of neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The variant rs538628, located within the NSF gene, was identified to associate with autism and education attainment. This SNP was reported in relation to autism severity and served as a central trait in the multivariate GWAS, indicating a shared liability with educational attainment.
title: Exploring autism and autism co-occurring condition associations to elucidate multivariate genetic mechanisms and insights

finding: The SNP rs62059712 was identified as associated with increased systolic blood pressure (SBP) in multiple studies. The major T allele (MAF 0.92) was linked to an increase in SBP by 0.39 mmHg per allele copy. Additionally, the minor C allele increased JMJD3 transcription via enhanced binding of the SP1 transcription factor, consequently affecting SMC plasticity and leading to hypertension through altered endothelin receptor expression.
title: Epigenetic Alteration of Smooth Muscle Cells Regulates Endothelin-Dependent Blood Pressure and Hypertensive Arterial Remodeling

finding: The SNP rs9988, within the NUP85 gene, was identified as a novel locus for anxiety, enhancing the genetic profile related to anxiety disorders.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs375241 associated with ASIC2/ACCN1 was categorized as a shared locus across multiple analyses, suggesting its potential role in neurotransmission related to anxiety and other psychiatric conditions.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The rs11540652 SNP in TP53 showed a significant association with lifespan reduction (HR = 10.0, p = 6.6 x 10^-8).
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The rs751713049 SNP in SRSF2 was significantly associated with mortality risk, with a hazard ratio of 5.8 and a p-value of 1.9 x 10^-26.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The protective allele (A) of rs7502834, located in intron 57 of the NF1 canonical transcript, was associated with the inclusion of a 77 bp alternative exon (exon 58) in NF1 transcripts expressed in subcutaneous adipose tissue. This finding was supported by splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) data, indicating that the splicing event may explain the genetic association with endometrial cancer risk.
title: Splicing annotation of endometrial cancer GWAS risk loci reveals potentially causal variants and supports a role for NF1 and SKAP1 as susceptibility genes

finding: The risk allele (A) of rs2278868 was a missense variant predicted to lead to exon skipping in exon 7 of the SKAP1 transcript, producing an out-of-frame alternative transcript subject to nonsense mediated decay (NMD). This was corroborated by sQTL data that showed the risk allele was associated with skipping of exon 7 in lymphocytes, supporting a causal role in increasing endometrial cancer risk.
title: Splicing annotation of endometrial cancer GWAS risk loci reveals potentially causal variants and supports a role for NF1 and SKAP1 as susceptibility genes

finding: The protective allele (T) of rs35888506 was predicted to activate an alternative 97 bp exon in NF1 by converting a GC splice site into a stronger GT splice site, resulting in a novel out-of-frame transcript expected to be subject to NMD. This allele was projected to increase expression of both the canonical and alternative NF1 transcripts.
title: Splicing annotation of endometrial cancer GWAS risk loci reveals potentially causal variants and supports a role for NF1 and SKAP1 as susceptibility genes

finding: The protective allele (A) of rs2854320 was predicted to enhance the inclusion of an alternative exon in NF1 by creating a branchpoint motif, potentially inserted at the C-terminus of the canonical NF1 protein. This SNP was expected to increase the expression of three alternative NF1 isoforms that are truncated.
title: Splicing annotation of endometrial cancer GWAS risk loci reveals potentially causal variants and supports a role for NF1 and SKAP1 as susceptibility genes

finding:
The 
HOXB13 c.G251G>A:p.G84E (rs138213197) variant was associated with a three-fold increase in prostate cancer (PCa) risk among male participants. Specifically, men heterozygous for this variant had a higher likelihood of receiving a PCa diagnosis (OR 2.60) and exhibited significant correlations with general PCa risk (HR 3.23), metastatic PCa risk (HR 2.96), and PCa mortality (HR 2.65). The findings emerged from a large cohort study of 592,158 men, with a notable prevalence in White men. The variant was also identified as an autosomal dominant risk allele and was predominantly found in individuals with a strong family history of PCa.
title: Association of HOXB13 G84E with prostate cancer among 592,158 men

finding: The rs77585764 variant, a missense variant in AFMID, was found to explain 15.5% of the phenotypic variance in N-formylanthranilic acid levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: Identified a nominal association (p=9.10E-08) near the CRHR1 gene, related to stress and anxiety disorders.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: This SNP had significant association (p=4.10E-08) near TBX21 and OSBPL7, relevant for BMI.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The rs975577 variant, located in the MRM1 gene, was significantly associated with functional fecal incontinence, demonstrating a robust link to this DGBI.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: Identified as the top variant in the MAPT locus with a significant association in both male (P=1.48E-32, beta=0.244) and female (P=5.02E-29, beta=0.268) PD cases.
title: Investigation of Autosomal Genetic Sex Differences in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The study confirmed the association of SNP rs17763050 with the H1 haplotype at the 17q21.31 locus, which was further linked to genetic predisposition in the context of Parkinson's disease (PD) diagnosis. This finding indicated that the presence of the H1 haplotype, particularly in the context of rs17763050, had significant implications for the understanding of genetic factors influencing PD.
title: Single-cell atlas of transcriptomic vulnerability across multiple neurodegenerative and neuropsychiatric diseases

finding: SNP rs8070723 was identified as a pivotal marker confirming the H1 haplotype at the 17q21.31 locus. Similar to rs17763050, it was involved in the assessment of genetic association with PD, suggesting that this SNP played a role in the genetic landscape associated with Parkinson's disease.
title: Single-cell atlas of transcriptomic vulnerability across multiple neurodegenerative and neuropsychiatric diseases

finding: The SNP rs117615688, located near the CRHR1 gene in the MAPT locus, replicated in the Latino cohort with nominal significance (p < 5.95×10−4), indicating a potential role in PD etiology.
title: Characterizing the genetic architecture of Parkinson’s disease in Latinos

finding: The association of rs4968646 with chronotype was attributed to altered expression of the gene CYB561, not TANC2. This suggested that rs4968646 serves as a genetic factor influencing chronotype.
title: Mendelian randomisation analysis using GWAS and eQTL data to investigate the relationship between chronotype and neuropsychiatric disorders and their molecular basis

finding: The study identified 5 patients with the rs80356892 mutation, of which 3 had bilateral primary breast cancer, accounting for 60% of those with the mutation. All 5 patients carrying the rs80356892 mutation had a family history of breast cancer, indicating a possible link between this SNP and hereditary breast cancer.
title: Investigation on the clinicopathological characteristics and BRCA1/2 gene variation of patients in breast cancer pedigrees in Northern Henan Province

finding: The SNP rs34931250 was linked to risk of coronary heart disease, indicated by a statistically significant finding (p=6.50x10^-7) associated with increased genetically-predicted expression of ABCA8. It displayed positive correlations with pro-atherogenic lipids, suggesting the gene's potential as a therapeutic target believed to influence cholesterol metabolism and atherogenesis.
title: Transcriptome- and proteome-wide Mendelian randomization to prioritize therapeutic targets for coronary heart disease

finding: The SNP rs146729640 reached genome-wide significance for its association with AAO in the Amish study, with a hazard ratio (HR) of 6.38. Subsequently, it was significantly replicated in the NIA-LOAD dataset with a nominal p-value of 0.02, marking it as a strong candidate in the SHISA6 gene, which is implicated in post-synaptic transmission related to cognitive processes.
title: Genetic variants in the SHISA6 gene are associated with delayed cognitive impairment in two family datasets

finding: The SNP rs12936231 has been established as a strong caQTL for enhancer activity and showed significant allelic imbalance (FDR 4.48e-25 for CD4 and 3.55e-33 for CD8). This established a link to multiple autoimmune conditions, implying disruptions in chromatin looping affect nearby gene regulation.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: At 17q21.31, rs72828815 was associated with mean diffusivity of the anterior corona radiata and was shown to have shared causal genetic variants with chronotype.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: At 17q21.31, rs1991556 was linked to mean diffusivity of the anterior corona radiata. It also shared genetic influences with sleep duration.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: At 17q21.31, rs2239923 was linked to mean diffusivity traits of the anterior corona radiata, marking its role in insomnia-related genetics.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Rs57222984 had genetic relationships with various sleep traits, contributing to insights about sleep behaviors.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant observed tied to unique sleep characteristics presented significant genetic implications.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP demonstrated pleiotropy with general cognitive ability and was associated with language delay and intellectual disability, validated across multiple cohorts.
title: Discovery of 42 Genome-Wide Significant Loci Associated with Dyslexia

finding: The variant was linked to cognitive performance and shown to have a meaningful association with dyslexia-related traits.
title: Discovery of 42 Genome-Wide Significant Loci Associated with Dyslexia

finding: The SNP rs78378222 was identified within the 3'UTR of the TP53 gene, where it altered the canonical polyadenylation signal from AATAAA to AATACA. This change impaired the 3' end processing of TP53 mRNA, significantly altering susceptibility to multiple cancers, including cutaneous basal cell carcinoma, prostate cancer, glioma, and colorectal adenoma.
title: A distinct class of pan-cancer susceptibility genes revealed by alternative polyadenylation transcriptome-wide association study

finding: The variant rs6416905 was identified as part of the first credible set of genetic variants associated with circulating sclerostin levels, having the largest posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.078. This SNP's association suggested a genetic predisposition influencing heel bone mineral density and osteoporosis.
title: A novel and efficient machine learning Mendelian randomization estimator applied to predict the safety and efficacy of sclerostin inhibition

finding: The variant rs66838809 was noted as a significant predictor of circulating sclerostin levels with a PIP of 0.48, and it exhibited a strong association with heel bone mineral density (P = 5.8 x 10^-38) and osteoporosis (OR = 0.83, P = 3.8 x 10^-17), indicating its relevance in these phenotypes.
title: A novel and efficient machine learning Mendelian randomization estimator applied to predict the safety and efficacy of sclerostin inhibition

finding: The intronic variant rs1568002709 at <italic>CRHR1</italic> showed significant association effects (OR = 0.62) in the context of the locus with little resolution due to LD structure.
title: Leveraging global multi-ancestry meta-analysis in the study of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis genetics

finding: The SNP rs77804065 at the CRHR1 locus showed a significant association with a p-value of 6.04×10−14. This locus was reaffirmed in the context of problematic alcohol use traits, indicating its importance in alcohol-related genetic studies.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: This SNP was found in the intron of TNFRSF13B, linking it to pathways responsible for B-cell activation and differentiation.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: This missense variant in TNFSF13 was previously reported for its role in immune responses, confirming its potential significance for SIgAD.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: This SNP was associated with GSDMB, revealing connections to childhood-onset asthma and possibly shared immune pathways.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: This SNP was in an intron of IKZF3, linked to both B-cell differentiation and an immunodeficiency syndrome.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: The Arg4810Lys variant (c.14429G>A) of RNF213 was identified in eleven young-onset familial Ischemic Stroke patients in a heterozygous form. The variant was positively correlated with a family history of stroke, earlier age at onset, and recurrent strokes, indicating its potential pathogenic role in non-MMD ischemic strokes among the Eastern Indian population.
title: Arg4810Lys Mutation in RNF213 among Eastern Indian Non-MMD Ischemic Stroke Patients: A Genotype-Phenotype Correlation

finding: Identified as the shared causal variant affecting both age at onset of walking and expression of KANSL1, positively correlated with increased walking onset and KANSL1 expression.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis of age at onset of walking

finding: This SNP was highlighted in the study as positively associated with age at onset of walking and with increased expression of KANSL1.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis of age at onset of walking

finding: This SNP was found to be a significant eSNP in the proximity to the genes KANSL1 and MAPT and was identified in the context of Alzheimer's disease, although linked primarily with the gene ARL17A in brain eQTLs.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: This SNP served as a significant eSNP in the KANSL1 region, paired with the gene LRRC37A2, and was associated with Alzheimer's disease risk. It also influenced the expression of the nearby gene ARL17A.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: The research revealed that the T allele of MAPT rs17649553 was associated with better verbal memory and higher small-world properties in the brain's network topology among PD patients. This suggests that this SNP's variation may contribute positively to cognitive functions, particularly verbal memory.
title: Structural network topology mediated cognitive impairment in Parkinson’s disease

finding: This SNP was identified as a missense mutation in the TP53 gene, found in samples from patients with DIPG, specifically linked to tumor growth and faulty protein formation.
title: A disease model for Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) with mutations in TP53 and its application for drug repurposing

finding: This SNP was also identified as a missense mutation in the TP53 gene in samples from patients with DIPG, contributing to the understanding of tumorigenesis in this context.
title: A disease model for Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) with mutations in TP53 and its application for drug repurposing

finding: This SNP was noted as a hotspot missense mutation in the TP53 gene in a specific patient, linking it to altered gene expression and possible implications for tumor behavior.
title: A disease model for Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) with mutations in TP53 and its application for drug repurposing

finding: Identified as a hotspot missense mutation in the TP53 gene, which was characterized in a patient sample and associated with changes in gene expression relevant to tumor dynamics.
title: A disease model for Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) with mutations in TP53 and its application for drug repurposing

finding: Discovery of this SNP indicated a significant deviation in gene expression similarity compared to average scores in patient samples, emphasizing its potential role in tumor growth and differentiation.
title: A disease model for Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) with mutations in TP53 and its application for drug repurposing

finding: The lead SNP rs62062288 was located in intron 6 of the microtubule associated protein tau (MAPT) gene on chromosome 17. It was significantly associated with the affective symptom group, with a P-value of 6.09×10-15. This SNP was implicated in affective symptoms, alcohol disorders, and risk-taking behavior, indicating a strong connection to mental health.
title: Environmental profiles of urban living relate to regional brain volumes and symptom groups of mental illness through distinct genetic pathways

finding: SNP rs11079173 in the PCTP locus showed association with PA(40:5) and PG(39:5), indicating its potential role in the transfer of phosphatidylcholines and contribution to lipid concentration modulation.
title: Genome-wide analysis of blood lipid metabolites in over 5,000 South Asians reveals biological insights at cardiometabolic disease loci

finding: The TP53 rs1042522 C>G polymorphism was associated with hepatoblastoma risk in Chinese children, highlighting its significance in pediatric liver cancer.
title: Identification of potential core genes in hepatoblastoma via bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs375822897, located in the PLEKHM1 gene region on chromosome 17, was identified as being associated with high delta age in a genetic association analysis. The study highlighted its significance with a p-value less than 0.05, indicating a potential link between genetic variations in this locus and brain aging as indicated by delta age.
title: Investigation of Genetic Variants and Causal Biomarkers Associated with Brain Aging

finding: Similarly, SNP rs56303031, associated with the LINC02210-CRHR1 gene region on chromosome 17, also demonstrated a statistically significant association with high delta age, with a p-value below 0.05. This finding further supported the investigation's conclusions regarding the role of genetic factors in brain aging.
title: Investigation of Genetic Variants and Causal Biomarkers Associated with Brain Aging

finding: The SNP rs295849 was positively associated with HDL-cholesterol (HDL-C) levels, modulating the relationship between physical activity (PA) and HDL-C in women. Specifically, carriers of the minor allele of rs295849 exhibited a stronger positive association with HDL-C in relation to PA (p_int = 0.002) in the Women's Genome Health Study (WGHS). Further exploration revealed a more significant interaction on medium-sized HDL particle concentrations (M-HDL-P) with an interaction p-value of 1.0x10^-4. This finding was consistent across cohorts and reinforced the hypothesis that the variant affects lipoprotein metabolism despite its location outside of clear gene regions.
title: Refinement of a published gene-physical activity interaction impacting HDL-cholesterol: role of sex and lipoprotein subfractions

finding: The SNP rs34001746 was significantly associated with earlier menopause as a missense variant in the gene TOP3A (p = 1.6 x 10<sup>-10</sup>). This variant was identified as the strongest rare variant association with earlier menopause and was associated with an increased likelihood of those carriers progressing from premenopausal to postmenopausal status during follow-up.
title: Rare coding variants in five DNA damage repair genes associate with timing of natural menopause

finding: The nonsense variant rs774881553-T in the HROB gene was associated with earlier menopause (p = 2.7 x 10<sup>-3</sup>), suggesting significant implications for menopause timing.
title: Rare coding variants in five DNA damage repair genes associate with timing of natural menopause

finding: The SNP rs1024611, specifically associated with the monocyte chemoattractant protein 1 gene, was investigated for its relationship with the severity of COVID-19. It was identified as a significant variant contributing to the severity of the disease.
title: Non-generalizability of biomarkers for mortality in SARS-CoV-2: a meta-analyses series

finding: The SNP rs12938775 was identified as an intronic variant in the gene PAFAH1B1 and was included in the credible sets of prioritized variants relating to hearing loss.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: The rs4343 variant, associated with ACE expression via Alu insertion/deletion, showed an allele frequency significantly higher in the Indian population compared to Europeans.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The allele frequency of rs2526327 was associated with decreased CCL5 expression, indicating a role in moderating COVID-19 severity.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The frequency of rs1994182 showed significant variation and its association with MMP28 may contribute to inflammatory responses in COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The T allele of rs2107538 was reported to influence CCL5 levels, possibly correlating with COVID-19 susceptibility in the Indian population.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The allele frequency for rs3817655 was significantly low in Indians, illustrating a connection to SARS-CoV susceptibility and severity.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs4239252 variant was found to influence CCL5 expression, which may modulate inflammation in COVID-19 cases.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs1024611 allele was associated with increased CCL2 expression, highlighted by significant allele frequency in Indians, indicating inflammation modulation.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs149932962 variant was identified as the most likely causal SNP linked to testosterone and DHT levels via the SHBG locus. It was noted for its role in binding steroid hormones, indicating a significant genetic impact on the transportation and modulation of these androgens.
title: Steroid hormone levels vary with sex, aging, lifestyle, and genetics

finding: The SNP rs17850455 was linked to POLG2 and was identified as a nonsynonymous variant, highlighting its potential importance in the context of mtDNA depletion.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The rs1642785 G>C variation in intron 2-3 was reported in 63.2% of HNC cases, being associated with lower transcript stability of p53 pre-mRNA and total TP53 levels. Its homozygous C genotype has been linked to chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).
title: Frequencies of TP53 Germline Variations and Identification of Two Novel 3’UTR Variants in a Series of Head and Neck Cancer Cases

finding: The rs1042522 G>C polymorphism (p.R72P) in exon 4 was identified in 66.6% of the HNC patients. This variant alters the proline-rich domain of p53 and is reported to have implications on apoptosis and growth suppression.
title: Frequencies of TP53 Germline Variations and Identification of Two Novel 3’UTR Variants in a Series of Head and Neck Cancer Cases

finding: The finding related to rs62637606 indicated it was a highly probable causal variant (PP=1.0) located in the PFAS locus. This association was part of a broader analysis of circulating fetal hemoglobin levels, which are relevant to sickle cell disease.
title: Genomic discovery and functional validation of MRP1 as a novel fetal hemoglobin modulator and potential therapeutic target in sickle cell disease

finding: The intronic variant rs529633547 in the CTC1 locus was identified as a probable causal variant with a posterior probability of 0.80. Its association was part of the investigation into genetic modulators of fetal hemoglobin levels.
title: Genomic discovery and functional validation of MRP1 as a novel fetal hemoglobin modulator and potential therapeutic target in sickle cell disease

finding: The SNP rs9303281 in GSDMB was associated with susceptibility to overall bronchiolitis, with a suggestive association in non-RSV bronchiolitis (p=6.2e-6) and no significant association with RSV bronchiolitis (p=0.24). The study found that the effect size was largest for non-RSV bronchiolitis, indicating that genetic variants in GSDMB may primarily mediate the risk of bronchiolitis due to non-RSV viral infections.
title: Genetic susceptibility to acute viral bronchiolitis

finding: In the context of hereditary breast cancer, c.2311T>C (rs16940) was noted to have an increased risk of contralateral breast cancer among women with known deleterious mutations in BRCA1. Conversely, it was found to be associated with a reduced risk in non-BRCA1 and non-BRCA2 carriers. This suggests a complex role for rs16940 in breast cancer risk which warranted further investigation.
title: Investigation of BRCA1 exon 11 genetic variations in breast cancer among Libyan women

finding: The SNP rs28934576 was identified as a rare P/LP mutation within the TP53 gene known for its association with Li-Fraumeni syndrome (LFS). The analysis outlined that carriers of this mutation exhibited a significant enrichment of sarcomas and other cancer types related to TP53 mutations.
title: A novel map of human p53 response elements uncovers evidence of selection pressures and variants similar to Li-Fraumeni Syndrome mutations

finding: The SNP rs11540652 was identified as a rare gain-of-function mutation within the TP53 gene, found in two of four sarcoma patients. This mutation was linked to several different sarcoma types, indicating its relevance in tumorigenesis within the context of mutations affecting p53 pathway activity.
title: A novel map of human p53 response elements uncovers evidence of selection pressures and variants similar to Li-Fraumeni Syndrome mutations

finding: The SNP rs8178395 was identified as significantly associated with an ADHD-adjacent autism spectrum disorder (ASD) diagnosis. It had a minor allele frequency of 0.14 and an odds ratio of 1.30, showing a significant increase in frequency among individuals diagnosed with both ADHD and ASD as compared to those with neither diagnosis. This locus was novel for its specific association to individuals with both ADHD and ASD, which had not been reported in past associations with either disorder individually.
title: Polygenic profiles define aspects of clinical heterogeneity in ADHD

finding: The TT genotype of rs11079983 in the HDAC5 gene was associated with a poorer treatment response compared to the CC genotype.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: Found to be associated with the shape of the right lateral ventricle and related white matter tracts, it also served as an eQTL for GNA13.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The variant was linked to an important measure of white matter microstructure, illustrating its relevance in the context of genetic architecture.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The rs12051560-A variant, located in the SLC39A11 gene at locus 17q24, was also associated with increased blood NfL levels, having an effect of 0.033 and a P-value of 9.94x10^-9. Its association with neurodegenerative pathways was further supported by its role in zinc homeostasis.
title: Genome-wide Association Study Meta-analysis of Neurofilament light (NfL) levels in blood reveals novel loci related to neurodegeneration

finding: IBSEP identified the SNP rs9904865 as a significant eQTL in the promoter region of the WNT3 gene, which is associated with various brain disorders. This finding was particularly noted in excitatory neurons and inhibitory neurons, indicating the SNP's regulatory role in WNT3 expression, which was not detected by prior methods.
title: A unified framework for cell-type-specific eQTLs prioritization by integrating bulk and scRNA-seq data

finding: The SNP rs62062288 was noted for having the most significant association in males with a P-value of 6.06×10^-13, linked to various internalizing psychopathologies.
title: Sex-specific genetic and transcriptomic liability to neuroticism

finding: The SNP rs55955207 was highlighted for its significance in females with a P-value of 3.62×10^-12, and it was positioned in a gene-dense region of chromosome 17 linked to other psychiatric disorders.
title: Sex-specific genetic and transcriptomic liability to neuroticism

finding: The SNP rs12946942 was associated with severe adolescent idiopathic scoliosis in a multiethnic meta-analysis. This indicated that genetic variants at this locus contribute to the risk of developing severe forms of scoliosis.
title: Variants in the SOX9 transactivation middle domain induce axial skeleton dysplasia and scoliosis

finding: The rs2270401 variant, located at 17q21.1 and associated with GSDMA, exhibited significant G x T interaction effects related to the white blood cell (WBC) count across gestational periods. The variant showed varying genetic effects, with the most substantial increase during the second trimester (β=0.396, P=1.62×10^-1223) compared to the postpartum period (β=0.122, P=6.48×10^-60). This indicated that the genetic effect of the A allele was 3.33 times greater in the second trimester than in the postpartum period, suggesting its critical role in the rapid growth of leukocytes during pregnancy.
title: The Dynamic Genetic Atlas of 122 Gestational Phenotypes

finding: The BRCA1 founder variant c.5207T>C (rs45553935) was identified as one of the two primary drifted variants responsible for the majority of pathogenic BRCA variant carriers in the Northern Isles, constituting part of the prevalent genetic landscape.
title: Two founder variants account for over 90% of pathogenic BRCA alleles in Orkney and Shetland

finding: The BRIP1 rs4988345 variant was significantly associated with PrCa risk (p=0.025) as identified in the combined datasets. This variant leads to a p.R173C amino acid change, impacting protein functionality and its potential role in DNA repair pathways.
title: Germline sequencing of DNA-damage-repair genes in two hereditary prostate cancer cohorts reveals new disease risk-associated gene variants

finding: This SNP was linked to rapid progression subtype (Subtype III), enhancing the understanding of genetic influences on disease trajectory.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Identified as associated with mild progression subtype (Subtype I), which may correlate with slower symptom onset and progression.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs8070723 was linked to reduced risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). It was in the same LD block with a 238bp deletion at chr17:46009357, located in the tau protein gene MAPT, indicated by an R2 value of 0.98.
title: A Specialized Reference Panel with Structural Variants Integration for Improving Genotype Imputation in Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Dementias (ADRD)

finding: The intergenic variant located at 17q24.3 showed protective effects for eGFR traits in the LLFS group, with a notably higher allele frequency compared to other populations.
title: Discovery of genomic and transcriptomic pleiotropy between kidney function and soluble receptor for advanced glycation end-products using correlated meta-analyses: The Long Life Family Study (LLFS)

finding: The variant rs72807981, located in the PIK3R5 gene, was identified as a novel risk factor associated with Braak NFT stage with a significant association (OR = 0.71, p = 3.9 × 10-8). This variant showed suggestive association in the National Alzheimer’s Coordinating Center (NACC) analysis and was nominally validated in the Adult Changes in Thought (ACT) study. The association implied a role for PIK3R5 in neurofibrillary pathology.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiple neuropathology endophenotypes identifies novel risk loci and provides insights into known Alzheimer’s risk loci

finding: The rs5848 SNP at the GRN locus showed a notably high association in the FTLD-TDP A subtype with an OR of 1.89 and a P-value of 5.57×10^-9, showcasing its importance in this specific pathological subtype.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs4987082 was highlighted among six SNPs with regulatory functions, which had high credibility for impacting transcription factor binding and correlating with gene target expression, emphasizing its relevance in genetic regulation concerning BCTs and CVDs.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: Identified in a novel locus and impacting protein-coding sequences, enhancing our insights into heart failure genetics.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: Shown to have significant association (P < 0.05) within the MRM1 gene, more significant than previous studies' findings on dyslexia.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: Identified as the SNP most associated with poorer reading ability, suggesting an impact that was previously unnoted.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: The SNP rs7215055 was associated with serum triglycerides and was also associated with the methylation of CpG cg11024682 and the expression of gene ATPAF2, with a probability of colocalization H4 of 100%.
title: Expression quantitative trait methylation analysis elucidates gene regulatory effects of DNA methylation: The Framingham Heart Study

finding: The rs4968782 variant in ACE demonstrated a protective effect on cardiovascular death or heart transplant in patients with atrial fibrillation (HR 0.85, P=0.0014) and a significant reduction in the composite outcome of heart failure rehospitalization or cardiovascular death/transplant (HR 0.84, P=0.017) after matching.
title: Combining Genetic Proxies of Drug Targets and Time-to-event analyses From Longitudinal Observational Data To Identify Target Patient Populations

finding: The protein-altering variant rs1801690 in the APOH gene showed a significant effect size of 0.10, being associated with creatine kinase concentrations, a marker for acute muscle injury.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The finding related to the SNP rs239358 showed that it was part of the APOE genotype, which is a significant indicator in determining APOE-carrier status. The study's adjustments for this genotype suggested its relevance in analyzing various cognitive outcomes in relation to anticholinergic burden.
title: Anticholinergic burden in middle and older age is associated with lower cognitive function, but not with brain atrophy

finding: The SNP rs12948394 was associated with SOCS3 expression predominantly in males, showing a strong male-specific association with body height (male p=9.67×10^-8, female p=7.68×10^-4). The colocalization analysis indicated a significant effect in males (PP4=0.93) but not in females (PP4=0.05), suggesting a male-specific mechanism of influence on height.
title: Biological sex affects functional variation across the human genome

finding: The SNP rs17651549 in the MAPT gene was associated with brain stem LBS at p=1.0E-13. This variant reported the highest CADD score (26.8) among exonic variants and was in high linkage disequilibrium with another SNP known for its involvement in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Beyond Volume: Unraveling the Genetics of Human Brain Geometry

finding: The lead SNP rs568589031 contributed significantly to the brain stem LBS (p=2.4E-16) and was part of a large genomic risk locus known for its complexity and associations with neurodegenarative diseases.
title: Beyond Volume: Unraveling the Genetics of Human Brain Geometry

finding: The SLC4A1 missense variant rs45562031-T was highlighted as significantly linked to pulmonary embolism with a HR of 3.23 (P=9.7×10^-12), with no observed effect in DVT.
title: Genomic Landscape of Thrombosis Recurrence Risk Across Venous Thromboembolism Subtypes

finding: The SNP rs1130371 was found to be associated with the proteins CCL18 and CCL3, illustrating its role in the pleiotropic effects of a single SNP affecting multiple molecular phenotypes.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The SNP rs34097845 was associated with both the expression of MPO and its corresponding protein, suggesting a shared regulatory mechanism at the genetic level for gene expression and protein levels.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: SNP rs10445391 was detected as a cis-pQTL for CCL16 in whole blood but indicated that the gene regulation occurs primarily in the liver; thus, it highlights the complexity of tissue-specific gene expression patterns.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The SNP rs480351, located in the gene body of NXN, demonstrated both positive and original findings. The study found that increased DNA methylation at this site correlated with an increased risk for estrogen-receptor positive breast cancer (ER+ BC) while showing a decreased risk for estrogen-receptor negative breast cancer (ER- BC).
title: Pre-diagnosis blood DNA methylation profiling of twin pairs discordant for breast cancer points to the importance of environmental risk

finding: The variant rs1819040 in KANSL1 was associated protectively against hospitalization and previously reported for its association with reduced lung function.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The variant rs12951632, an intron variant of RETREG3, was identified with a p-value of 0.026. This finding indicated a possible association with CSF alpha-synuclein seed amplification assay status among LRRK2 parkinsonism cases.
title: LRRK2-Associated Parkinsonism With and Without In Vivo Evidence of Alpha-Synuclein Aggregates

finding: The NDP52<sup>GE</sup> variant (c.491G>A, rs550510, p.G140E) was identified as a protective factor against Alzheimer's disease (AD). A genetic association case-control analysis demonstrated that the frequency of allele A was significantly lower in AD patients compared to control subjects, with a p-value of 0.0042, indicating a protective effect (Odds Ratio, OR A=0.72). Additionally, the homozygous genotype (AA) was found to be protective with an OR AA=0.52. The variant's ability to enhance autophagic degradation of pathological TAU suggests that NDP52<sup>GE</sup> mitigates neurodegeneration associated with AD.
title: A variant of the autophagic receptor NDP52 counteracts phospho-TAU accumulation and emerges as a protective factor for Alzheimer Disease

finding: This SNP was linked to NAFLD owing to its coding missense variant which reached genome-wide significance.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: Considered the strongest effect SNP associated with mLOY, located in the TP53 oncogene with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.664 and a highly significant p-value of 1.44×10^-90.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of mosaic loss of chromosome Y in the Million Veteran Program identifies 167 novel loci

finding: The rs11567842 variant, located in the SLC13A2 gene, was associated with urinary citrate concentration and previously linked to blood urea nitrogen concentration. This variant indicated associations with multiple DKD phenotypes and eGFR, establishing its relevance in kidney health.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: This SNP was linked to the diastolic measure of mitral valve annular diameter. Specifically, it was associated with an enhancer element in GOSR2 that disrupts a KLF4 binding motif, impacting GOSR2 expression levels.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: This SNP was identified in relation to systolic measurements of mitral valve annular diameter, with strong evidence suggesting a role in the genetic architecture of valve disease.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: This SNP was associated with larger mitral valve annular diameter in diastole and displayed correlations to cerebrovascular disease risk.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: This SNP showed strong linkage with variants associated with congenital cardiovascular malformations, indicating its relevance in cardiac valve biology.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: The SNP rs9303277 was significantly associated with the gene ORMDL3, which previously demonstrated a strong correlation with primary biliary cholangitis (PBC) in prior studies. It exhibited notable cell-specific expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) effects among various immune cell types, with the most significant association seen in naive B cells, TFH+CD4+ T cells, and NK cells, indicating its role in modulating immune responses relevant to PBC.
title: Combination of single cell sequencing data and GWAS summary statistics reveals genetically-influenced liver cell types for primary biliary cholangitis

finding: The SNP rs9893381 in DNAI2 was identified as suggestively significant with p=4.89×10^-7.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs665268 corresponded to a missense variant (p.Q139R) in the MLX gene, which was also nominated as a top candidate gene linked to PD. MLX, a transcription factor regulating glucose metabolism, was shown to modulate oxidation and autophagy pathways relevant to PD. The mutation was predicted to enhance interactions within transcriptional networks, influencing transcriptional repression, and potentially affecting pathways linked to PD.
title: Identification of novel variants, genes and pathways potentially linked to Parkinson’s disease using machine learning

finding: The missense mutation rs114001633 (p.Pro227Leu) on SREBF1 was identified as genome-wide significantly associated with hemorrhagic stroke, achieving a p-value of 8.96×10^-9. This variant replicated in T1D, although caution was advised due to its ultra-rare occurrence.
title: Whole-genome sequencing identifies variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: The missense SNP rs1801689 was located in the APOH gene, which encodes for beta-2 glycoprotein involved in triglyceride-rich lipoprotein metabolism. This SNP was associated with alterations in lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs773553186, representing a mutation c.A1073T in the TP53 gene, was observed in 0.35% (2 out of 571) of patients with ESCC. This mutation was recorded in the International Agency for Research on Cancer TP53 database and included in the pathogenic mutations identified in the study.
title: Comprehensive Study of Germline Mutations and Double-Hit Events in Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer

finding: The rs3859191-G allele linked to GSDMA was noted for increased transcript levels in lung contexts, which may play a role in COVID-19 pathology.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: This variant was linked to DLX3 and was involved in regulating gene expressions relevant to COVID-19 in pulmonary environments.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: The SNP rs2070835 was identified in the exonic region of the VAT1 gene, which plays a key role in the transport of neurotransmitters. It was associated with basal ganglia volume and exhibited a CADD score of 12.64, signifying potential deleterious effects. This SNP was also previously connected with Parkinson's disease.
title: Unveiling the Genetic Landscape of Basal Ganglia: Implications for Common Brain Disorders

finding: The SNP rs8482 was located in the exonic region of NBR1, which is involved in autophagy and Lewy body formation related to Parkinson's disease. It was identified as a significant finding associated with basal ganglia volumes.
title: Unveiling the Genetic Landscape of Basal Ganglia: Implications for Common Brain Disorders

finding: The SNP rs2227322, located in the CSF3 gene, demonstrated a high trait-increasing effect size of 0.07 with a p-value of 4.12 x 10^-20. This gene is responsible for granulocyte synthesis and cytokine-related inflammatory responses.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study of neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio and polygenic risk score development to explore causal association with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The SNP rs3826331 was found to be statistically significant in the initial analysis but had a reversed effect in subsequent replication with a Beta of 0.06 and a p-value of 1.5 x 10^-6.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study of neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio and polygenic risk score development to explore causal association with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The <italic>MAPT</italic> rs8070723 H2 allele was found to be associated with an increased risk of Pick's disease (PiD) with an odds ratio of 1.35 (95% CI: 1.12-1.64, P=0.002), indicating that this variant contributed to the susceptibility to PiD in the analyzed cohort.
title: Creating the Pick’s disease International Consortium: Association study of MAPT H2 haplotype with risk of Pick’s disease

finding: At the TNFSF13 locus, rs3803800 showed a suggestive significant association with IgA levels (Beta=0.06, P=9.41×10^-08).
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs41283425 was identified as a coding variant associated with the JUP gene, which is related to known cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs72839768 was identified as a novel association with pelvic organ prolapse, exhibiting a significant p-value of 4.66 × 10^-9. This non-synonymous missense variant is located in the DVL2 gene.
title: Advancing our understanding of genetic risk factors and potential personalized strategies in pelvic organ prolapse: largest GWAS to date reveals 19 novel associated loci

finding: The SNP rs148096119 was associated with residual memory slope, with findings indicating that five out of six carriers exhibited episodic memory decline, marking it as a significant risk variant for episodic memory issues associated with the gene ZEF1.
title: Rare genetic coding variants associated with age-related episodic memory decline implicate distinct memory pathologies in the hippocampus

finding: The MAPT rs17649553 T allele was associated with better verbal memory and higher small-world properties in Parkinson's disease, which points to a beneficial effect on cognitive function and brain network efficiency.
title: Striatal dopamine depletion drives disease progression and network topology aberrations specifically by impairing left M1 network

finding: Lead SNP for the suggestive locus at 17q24.2, associated with both general cleft palate (ACP) and cleft soft palate (CSP), with nominal evidence of association in cleft hard palate (CHP).
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: Lead SNP for suggestive significance at locus 17q24.2 associated with cleft soft palate (CSP) and was also shared with general cleft palate (ACP) analysis.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: The SNP rs538628 explained over 0.8 of variance in the expression of the trans-eGene AC126544.2, signifying a major influence on the gene's expression levels.
title: Whole Genome DNA and RNA Sequencing of Whole Blood Elucidates the Genetic Architecture of Gene Expression Underlying a Wide Range of Diseases

finding: The rs78378222 SNP, located in the TP53 3'-UTR, was associated with an increased risk of high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC) with a per-allele relative risk of 1.44 (95% CI: 1.28-1.62, P=1.76×10^-9). This variant was highlighted as an interesting finding, suggesting its crucial role in cancer susceptibility.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The intronic rs143094271 variant in the TNFS13 gene exhibited increased risk for HGSOC, highlighting a potential association between immune signaling pathways and ovarian cancer susceptibility.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs9889282 was the most significantly associated locus with neck or shoulder pain, located near the CA10 gene on chromosome 17 (p = 2.63 x 10^-12). This gene encodes a carbonic anhydrase involved in bone resorption and is linked to neuropathic pain mechanisms. This finding contributed to understanding genetic factors influencing musculoskeletal disorders.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Neck or Shoulder Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The rs1568061110 variant in the ACTG1 gene (c.737A>T, p.Gln246Leu) was identified as the likely genetic cause of autosomal dominant non-syndromic hearing loss (ADNSHL) in a five-generation family. The variant was heterozygous in all affected family members and absent in those with normal hearing, indicating a clear association with hearing loss. Additionally, the change from glutamine to leucine at position 246 was predicted to be damaging based on multiple in silico tools, showing its potential deleterious nature. Furthermore, the residue at position 246 is highly conserved across species.
title: Responsiveness of the electrically stimulated cochlear nerve in patients with a missense variant in ACTG1: Preliminary Results

finding: The SNP MAPT rs17649553 was noted for its substantial effect on gene expression across various brain regions, highlighting its potential relevance to Parkinson's disease.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: This SNP had been associated with 'cardiac septal defects'. The PheWAS analysis employing Peds-Phecodes identified several significant associations with multiple relevant phenotypes: phecode 747.113 'Common ventricle', phecode 747.128 'Atresia and stenosis of aorta', and phecode 747.133 'Patent ductus arteriosus', demonstrating greater detail compared to the singular significant association obtained with traditional phecodes.
title: Developing and Evaluating Pediatric Phecodes (Peds-Phecodes) for High-Throughput Phenotyping Using Electronic Health Records

finding: At the CDK12 locus, the lead SNP rs11078912 showed a beta of 0.07 indicating a novel association with 3-Methylhistidine, suggesting its role in muscle protein turnover.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The variant rs61667602 associated with CRHR1 was associated with reduced risk of post-inflammatory pulmonary fibrosis, showing an OR of 0.84 (p=2.26 × 10^-12). This association illustrated its importance in respiratory conditions related to COVID-19 severity.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs62063281, which tags a common inversion on chromosome 17, was linked to an increase in IVS.csad with a Beta of 8.6 mm² (p=1.3e-13). This variant impacts the KANSL1 gene and was found to be a strong splice QTL for KANSL1. The inversion disrupts local chromatin structure affecting various genes, implicating it in the risk for ventricular septal defects (VSD).
title: Genetic determinants of interventricular septal anatomy and the risk of ventricular septal defects and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with TNFSF12, suggesting a role as a cis-pQTL.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: This SNP was demonstrated to be intronic to APOH, acting as a cofactor for plasminogen activation.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The rs12150284 variant contributed to shared genetic signals linked to POAG and PACG, further elucidating the interconnected nature of glaucoma subtypes.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation
