finding: The SNP rs1008723 was associated with the 17q12 locus, which was jointly associated with all autoimmune diseases studied and atrial fibrillation, except for primary sclerosing cholangitis and atrial fibrillation. This SNP is in the intronic region of the gene GSDMB, which plays crucial roles in pyroptosis and is implicated in the pathogenesis of autoimmune diseases and cardiovascular diseases.
title: Genetic analyses identify shared genetic components related to autoimmune and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs373862041 corresponded to the ultra-rare missense mutation in PPM1D (c.131C>G; p.S44W) found in a pair of affected siblings who had been diagnosed with pediatric acute onset neuropsychiatric syndrome (PANS). This mutation had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.000255 and was inherited from an asymptomatic parent with a family history of autoimmune disorders.
title: Identification of ultra-rare genetic variants in Pediatric Acute Onset Neuropsychiatric Syndrome (PANS) by exome and whole genome sequencing

finding: This SNP exhibited a significant association with tau pathology in females only, highlighting its potential influence on AD-related neurodegeneration processes.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs1075901 was associated with BMI at a beta of 0.012 and a P value of 4.4 × 10^-13, marking its relevance in genetic studies related to body mass.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: This SNP spanned the SMG6 and SRR loci and was the most significant eQTL for SRR in arterial tissue, underlining its functional impact on smooth muscle cell contraction.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The SLC25A11 variant rs139336593-G was identified at a novel gout-associated locus at 17p13.2. It showed negative associations with both glucose and lactate but not with urate levels, indicating that its association with gout may stem from factors independent of urate metabolism.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: The intronic SNP rs35850753 in the TP53 region was linked to an increased risk of multiple invasive cancers (OR=1.35, P=1.2x10^-8).
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: The study revealed that the rs799905 SNP was associated with preferential methylation in both normal and tumor cells of breast cancer patients. Specifically, among 15 informative individuals heterozygous for rs799905, five showed methylation on the same allele in both normal and tumor cells, indicating a shared clonal origin. Additionally, in umbilical cord blood of newborn girls, a significant portion of heterozygous individuals also exhibited similar allele-specific methylation patterns. This finding underscored the role of rs799905 in predisposition to BRCA1 epimutations, contributing to the risk of triple-negative breast cancer.
title: Prenatal BRCA1 epimutations contribute significantly to triple-negative breast cancer development

finding: Part of the findings that established a shared genetic correlation between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: Associated with the gene GGNBP2, this SNP served as a significant shared genetic risk factor for both BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: This SNP was linked with the gene GGNBP2, marking a significant shared genetic association between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: rs7221651 on chromosome 17 was also found to be significantly associated with chronic dizziness in the European cohort, with a p-value of 3.71 x 10^-10, highlighting its relevance to the phenotype in this population.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Novel Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: In trans-ancestry analysis, rs72631329 on chromosome 17 demonstrated significance and was noted for its linkage with rs7221651, reinforcing the findings related to chronic dizziness across various cohorts.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Novel Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: In stage 1, the SNP rs2526377 associated with the TSPOASP1-AS1 locus showed a significant association linked to Alzheimer's disease, reinforcing prior findings in GWAS.
This SNP was significant in the CD-PBC cross-trait analysis and was among the shared risk SNPs reported that link IBD and PBC.
title: Rare Comorbidity between Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Primary Biliary Cholangitis: Evidence from Causality, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: Previously discovered, this SNP was found to affect the pathogenesis of PBC by altering FOXO1 binding affinity, linking it to both PBC and IBD mechanisms.
title: Rare Comorbidity between Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Primary Biliary Cholangitis: Evidence from Causality, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: The rs882380 variant was identified in the context of FGT polyps and associated with malignancies, suggesting its relationship to neoplastic processes.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The SNP rs1129506 showed some association with FGT polyps and had been previously linked to endometrial cancer, indicating a potential overlap in underlying mechanisms.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: This variant was found to be nominally significant in the association with endometrial cancer, emphasizing its relevance to the study of FGT polyps.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The SNP rs35296742 located on AOC2 was uniquely associated with a diameter about 13mm distal to the sinotubular junction. The association was significant for predicting the incidence of thoracic aortic aneurysm.
title: Using Machine Learning to Elucidate the Spatial and Genetic Complexity of the Ascending Aorta

finding: This SNP was part of the credible set for the chromosome 17 locus and had noted significance in contributing to otosclerosis risk.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: The SNP rs1052536 was associated with QTc duration, indicating that genetic variations at this locus are relevant to QT interval prolongation, adding to the genetic understanding of the trait.
title: Genetic QT Score and Sleep Apnea as Predictors of Sudden Cardiac Death in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs708382 was identified as a lead variant in locus 28, which was associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). It mapped to the ITGA2B gene region based on significant variants in high linkage disequilibrium (R2 > 0.9). This SNP played a role in linking genetic variants to LOAD pathology.
title: Largest GWAS (N=1,126,563) of Alzheimer’s Disease Implicates Microglia and Immune Cells

finding: The SNP rs5911 was noted as an exonic variant within the ITGA2B gene and had a high CADD score of 19.8. It was highlighted in relation to LOAD due to its significant association in locus 28, suggesting a potential role in the disease’s genetic architecture.
title: Largest GWAS (N=1,126,563) of Alzheimer’s Disease Implicates Microglia and Immune Cells

finding: The variant rs7221167 was found at the 17:43205356-45363133 locus and was associated with the B1 phenotype, highlighting its connection to COVID-19 severity, particularly among hospitalized patients.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: At the 17:43205356-45363133 locus, rs1819040 served as the lead variant linked to the B2 phenotype, demonstrating its unique genetic association with COVID-19.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: The variant rs7225002 at the 17:43205356-45363133 locus was associated with B1 phenotype signals, highlighting its role in differentiating severity outcomes in COVID-19 patients.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: The intergenic signal rs2584662, located between PHB and ZNF652, was associated with ACO showing an odds ratio of 0.92 and a p-value of 2.21×10<sup>–8</sup>. This signal had prior associations with asthma, indicating its potential role in allergic conditions.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: The MAPT rs17649553 T allele was associated with better verbal memory and higher small-world properties in patients with Parkinson's disease. This finding indicated that the T allele may contribute positively to cognitive function in these patients.
title: High-level anxiety is associated with worse clinical symptoms and aberrant brain networks in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs62055708 was associated with Parkinson's disease (PD) and several other neurological traits. It was located within candidate silencers across various CNS biosamples, except the middle frontal area. The C to A change resulted in a delta repression score of 0.20 in neuronal stem cells, correlating with an MPRA score of 0.42, which indicated altered binding site dynamics for transcriptional factors.
title: The contribution of silencer variants to human diseases

finding: The SNP rs75104593 was associated with Parkinson's disease with a substitution from T to G observed to enhance repression. This finding correlated with increased significance for binding motifs associated with known repressor transcription factors.
title: The contribution of silencer variants to human diseases

finding: The SNP rs62057121, associated with Type 1 diabetes, exhibited notable mMPRA and vMPRA scores, with delta repression indicating its regulatory role in candidate silencers, particularly affecting NFKB1 binding.
title: The contribution of silencer variants to human diseases

finding: The SNP rs12949906 has been found to have enhanced gene expressions in dendritic cells, emphasizing its role in the immune system.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: This SNP in the SOST region was associated with circulating sclerostin (β=-0.088, P=1.45×10^-9), signifying its relevance and promoting further explorations into how sclerostin affects diabetes and cardiovascular conditions.
title: Lowering of circulating sclerostin may increase risk of atherosclerosis and its risk factors: evidence from a genome-wide association meta-analysis followed by Mendelian randomization

finding: This SNP contributed across multiple super-variants including chr17_26, which involves genes that connect to immune responses, hinting at possible increased COVID-19 mortality risk.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: This SNP was associated with the gene WSB1, affecting the immune pathway and potentially linked to higher mortality rates from COVID-19.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: SNP rs709591 showed a significant association with MT-CN with a P value of 1.61x10^-4, indicating a link with neutrophil count. This indicates that it is involved in hematological parameters and suggests a relationship between blood cell composition and MT-CN measurements.
title: Mitochondrial genome copy number measured by DNA sequencing in human blood is strongly associated with metabolic traits via cell-type composition differences

finding: The G allele of the rs4341 polymorphism was associated with severe COVID-19 outcomes in hypertensive patients, with a significant correlation to higher mortality and severity in dyslipidemic (p<0.05) and type 2 diabetic patients (p<0.01). This polymorphism conferred an added risk factor for adverse outcomes, particularly in those with hypertension, facilitating more precise management of infected patients.
title: ACE gene variants rise the risk of severe COVID-19 in patients with hypertension, dyslipidemia or diabetes. A pilot study

finding: Similar to rs4341, the G allele of rs4343 was linked to increased severity and mortality in COVID-19 patients with hypertension. The study indicated this polymorphism was associated with higher prevalence of adverse outcomes in dyslipidemic (p<0.05) and type 2 diabetic patients (p<0.001), thus indicating a combinatory risk factor for those conditions in relation to severe COVID-19.
title: ACE gene variants rise the risk of severe COVID-19 in patients with hypertension, dyslipidemia or diabetes. A pilot study

finding: It was identified at locus 17q24.1 with a p-value of 1.22×10^-6 and OR=2.07, located in an intron of PRKCA.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The SNP rs62062271 was related to brain eQTL expressions of multiple genes and associated with Parkinson's disease, suggesting its importance in the context of neurodegenerative disorders.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs2281727 was associated with schizophrenia, indicating a genetic overlap with cardiovascular traits in the 17p13.3 region.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs903503 was confirmed as an eQTL and was involved in multiple mental health conditions like bipolar disorder and neuroticism, showcasing a shared genetic basis.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs10852923 was associated with multiple neuropsychiatric disorders, suggesting significant cross-talk between cardiovascular health and mental disorders.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs118087478 was identified within eQTL contexts, linking it with cardiovascular traits and reflecting broader implications for multi-organ health.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The variant rs12453682 upstream of NEUROD2 was associated with lower apparent fiber density in tracts through the internal capsule extending to the brainstem and cerebellar peduncles, indicating its impact on white matter microstructure in dyslexia.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The intronic MAPT variant rs12150530 was linked to volumetric associations in the temporal lobes, reinforcing its relevance to dyslexia through its structural brain connections.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The SNP rs34872586 was part of the findings indicating shared causal variants in the context of PTSD and cardiovascular disease traits.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs3803800 in the TNFSF13 gene was also identified as significant. This SNP was linked to a p.(Asn96Ser) alteration, indicating that it was involved in the association with IgAN. However, specific details regarding its impact on gene expression or function were not explicitly detailed in the provided context.
title: GWAS defines pathogenic signaling pathways and prioritizes drug targets for IgA nephropathy

finding: SNP rs8065294 within CACNG4 showed a significant association with IR, where the C allele was associated with higher risk (for T/C: OR = 1.88; 95% CI: 0.94-3.74; p = 0.0006; for C/C: OR = 7.05; 95% CI: 2.23-22.23; p = 0.0006), with a codominant inheritance model being the most fitting.
title: Unveiling Genetic Associations: Investigating CLDN16, GRID2, NRG3, and CACNG4 Gene Polymorphisms with Insulin Resistance Risk Among Normal BMI Individuals in the Indian Population

finding: The SNP rs139356332 was found proximal to the gene MFAP4, involved in inflammatory mechanisms. It was primarily explained by inflammation-related traits in factor 86, contributing to the shared biology observed in rheumatoid arthritis.
title: A scalable variational approach to characterize pleiotropic components across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics

finding: This synonymous variant was fine-mapped for alkaline phosphatase and had significant associations with albumin and cholesterol levels.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This variant, identified to be linked to coronary artery disease, showed independent behavior from rs55714927.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This 3' UTR variant was associated with skin cancer and regulates expression related to TP53.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Fine-mapped for eosinophil count, associated with the EPX gene.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Identified as an intergenic variant related to eosinophil count, located near EPX.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs378392, located in the intron of the ribosomal protein S26 pseudogene 8 (RPS26P8) on chromosome 17, was associated with PRISm with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.992. Prior studies in non-UK Biobank populations had established associations of this gene with Forced Expiratory Volume (FEV1) and Forced Vital Capacity (FVC).
title: Epidemiology and Genetics of Preserved Ratio Impaired SpiroMetry (PRISm): An Analysis of UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs553682853 was also found on chromosome 17 with an odds ratio for PRISm of 0.990. It was associated with the N-Ethylmaleimide Sensitive Factor (NSF) gene, which had historical associations with FEV1 and FVC in UK Biobank studies.
title: Epidemiology and Genetics of Preserved Ratio Impaired SpiroMetry (PRISm): An Analysis of UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1991556 presented an odds ratio of 0.91 for PRISm and was strongly linked to lung function measures, specifically FEV1 and FVC, with p-values indicating very strong associations. It was found in the MAPT gene and demonstrated some association with self-reported emphysema and asthma diagnosis.
title: Epidemiology and Genetics of Preserved Ratio Impaired SpiroMetry (PRISm): An Analysis of UK Biobank

finding: Located in the Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma Gene (ASPSCR1) on chromosome 17, rs7213474 was associated with PRISm with an odds ratio of 1.006. PheWAS further supported strong associations with FEV1, FVC, and PEFR.
title: Epidemiology and Genetics of Preserved Ratio Impaired SpiroMetry (PRISm): An Analysis of UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was linked to proteinuria in mothers and located intronically within SMG6, suggesting its involvement in severe preeclampsia cases.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: The variant rs799917 (T>C) was identified as a significant factor contributing to the increased frequency of BRCA1 germline mutations among Nigerian (NG) men and men of African ancestry (MAA). It correlates with higher cancer risks in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma, gastric, lung, and triple-negative breast cancers, indicating its potential role in tumorigenesis.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing of Nigerian Prostate Tumors from the Prostate Cancer Transatlantic Consortium (CaPTC) Reveals DNA Repair Genes Associated with African Ancestry

finding: Variant rs16942 showed moderate frequency in NG samples, and like rs16941, it was observed to be prevalent in European lineage, indicating differential frequency patterns across ethnic groups.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing of Nigerian Prostate Tumors from the Prostate Cancer Transatlantic Consortium (CaPTC) Reveals DNA Repair Genes Associated with African Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs8065800 at the 17q21.31 locus was identified as a risk allele associated with severe COVID-19 in the Spanish cohort, with a P-value of 1.16×10^-8, an odds ratio (OR) of 1.67 for the minor allele G, and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.49-1.84.
title: New susceptibility loci for severe COVID-19 by detailed GWAS analysis in European populations

finding: The SNP rs1819040 was prioritized in the meta-analysis as the most significantly associated variant at the 17q21.31 locus with severe COVID-19, showing a P-value of 3.27×10^-11 and an odds ratio of 0.88 for the minor allele T, indicating a protective effect.
title: New susceptibility loci for severe COVID-19 by detailed GWAS analysis in European populations

finding: Associated with chronic dizziness on chromosome 17, it exhibited high linkage disequilibrium with rs7221651, reinforcing the genetic correlation between these variants.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The SNP rs34974290, located at the TRIM47 gene on chromosome 17q25, was significantly associated with both fronto-parietal and anterior periventricular WMH. It exhibited a meta-estimate of 0.142 for fronto-parietal WMH (meta-pFDR=0.018) and 0.128 for anterior PV WMH (meta-pFDR=0.049), highlighting its relevance to WMH volume.
title: White matter hyperintensity spatial patterns: risk factors and clinical correlates

finding: The SNP rs9909593 was identified as significant in the shared genetic architecture between RA and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs16940677 was a co-localized locus for SLE and severe COVID-19, suggesting genetic overlap in pathophysiology.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs62057151 was significant in the shared genetic architecture between SLE and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The lead SNV on NSF, associated with MAPT and KANSL1, was suggestive in all three models, contributing to known Alzheimer's disease risk loci.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs771699440 was identified in the context of Alexander disease, linked to a heterozygous non-synonymous mutation c.626G>A (p.R209Q) in the GFAP gene, where the patient's mother was found to be positive for this known mutation. This finding corroborated the involvement of this variant in the pathogenesis of the disease phenotype, which includes neurodegeneration and formation of Rosenthal fibers in astrocytes.
title: Alexander Disease: Screening and in silico functional characterization of variants on candidate gene

finding: This SNP, close to rs918121801, was associated with testicular dysfunction and hypofunction in the European ancestry group, pointing to the complexity of testosterone regulation across different ancestries.
title: Discovery of Novel Trans-Ancestry and Ancestry-Specific Gene Loci for Total Testosterone in a Multi-Ancestral Analysis of Men in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs4273100 variant in the 17p11.2 region was implicated in schizophrenia and demonstrated the strongest associations with the default mode network in resting fMRI, highlighting its role in psychiatric disorders.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The MAPT rs17649553 T allele was associated with better verbal memory and higher small-world properties in patients with Parkinson's disease. This indicated that individuals carrying the T allele potentially had enhanced cognitive functions, such as memory, despite the cognitive impairments commonly observed in Parkinson's disease, thereby offering insight into how genetic factors could influence cognitive outcomes in this patient population.
title: Structural network topology correlates with cognitive impairment in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs203462 was described as potentially deleterious, linking it to the genetic underpinnings of pain intensity.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The SNP rs78378222 was also identified as a novel locus linked to PCOS and was shown to be a significant eQTL for the tumor suppressor gene TP53 in several tissues, including adipose tissue. The findings imply associations with risks of uterine fibroids, gliomas, and influences on SHBG and testosterone levels.
title: Understanding and Predicting Polycystic Ovary Syndrome through Shared Genetic Architecture with Testosterone, SHBG, and Inflammatory Markers

finding: The rs1005714 SNP mapped to the NUP85 locus and was associated with elevated MRPS7 mRNA levels in lung tissues from patients with SSC-ILD based on eQTL data. Additionally, it was linked through co-accessibility analysis to MRPS7, indicating its functional relevance.
title: Integrative single-cell analysis of epigenomic and transcriptomic states in patients with systemic sclerosis-associated interstitial lung disease

finding: Located at 17p11.2, rs12602286 was associated with cognitive ability and education, particularly in the context of default mode network interactions.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The intron variant rs62075723-G in TSPAN10, linked to ACTG1, was associated with thickening of the ganglion cell layer (GCL) (beta=0.13 SD per A allele, P=3.93x10^-63) and thinning of the photoreceptor segments (PS) (beta=-0.07 per A allele, P=9.53x10^-20), and also identified as increasing the risk of age-related macular degeneration (AMD) (OR 1.12, 95% CI: 1.09-1.16, P=2.5x10^-11).
title: Insights into human health from phenome- and genome-wide analyses of UK Biobank retinal optical coherence tomography phenotypes

finding: This SNP was associated with increased bone mineral density (BMD) and reduced fracture risk, with an overall effect size of 0.026 (95% CI: 0.023-0.028; p-value = 1.02 x 10^-70; N = 426,824). Despite associations with skeletal-related phenotypes, it showed no correlation with myocardial infarction or stroke.
title: Genetic and atherosclerotic plaque immunohistochemical analyses do not associate reduced sclerostin expression with cardiovascular events

finding: Similar to rs9899889, this SNP showed positive associations with increased BMD and reduced fracture risk. It was part of a group of variants associated with skeletal phenotypes, yet no association with cardiovascular events was detected post multiple testing corrections.
title: Genetic and atherosclerotic plaque immunohistochemical analyses do not associate reduced sclerostin expression with cardiovascular events

finding: This SNP was associated with positive outcomes for BMD and reduction in fracture risk, consistent with the findings of rs9899889 and rs1107748. No significant cardiovascular associations were found.
title: Genetic and atherosclerotic plaque immunohistochemical analyses do not associate reduced sclerostin expression with cardiovascular events

finding: This SNP showed positive associations with increased BMD phenotypes consistent with other variants in the SOST region but did not demonstrate any cardiovascular risk associations after adjustments for correlation.
title: Genetic and atherosclerotic plaque immunohistochemical analyses do not associate reduced sclerostin expression with cardiovascular events

finding: Associated with positive effects on BMD, this SNP likewise did not display significant associations with cardiovascular outcomes in quantitative analyses.
title: Genetic and atherosclerotic plaque immunohistochemical analyses do not associate reduced sclerostin expression with cardiovascular events

finding: This SNP yielded positive correlations with increased BMD as purported as well as consistent findings of effectively no cardiovascular risk association.
title: Genetic and atherosclerotic plaque immunohistochemical analyses do not associate reduced sclerostin expression with cardiovascular events

finding: Associated with increased BMD, this variant was consistent with all previously analyzed SNPs in showing no associations with significant cardiovascular events.
title: Genetic and atherosclerotic plaque immunohistochemical analyses do not associate reduced sclerostin expression with cardiovascular events

finding: The rs2555111 variant in the HOXB3 gene exhibited a strong eQTL effect with the lowest p-value of 1.40e-62, correlating each copy of the T allele with higher grip strength and upregulating multiple HOXB genes across various tissues, including muscle-skeletal tissue.
title: A GWAS for grip strength in cohorts of children – advantages of analysing young participants for this trait

finding: The rs9903642 variant located near KAT7 was identified as a novel locus associated with increased COVID-19 hospitalization risk, with a MAF of 4%, an OR of 1.32, and a significant p-value of 1.4×10^-8.
title: Common genetic variants identify targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with the expression of GSDMA in macrophages, but not in dendritic cells, indicating a cell type-specific regulatory effect.
title: History of tuberculosis disease is associated with genetic regulatory variation in Peruvians

finding: The pathogenic missense variant c.5207T>C; p.Val1736Ala (V1736A) was identified in multiple clinical cases as segregating with breast and ovarian cancer in Orcadian women. This variant was noted for its significantly higher prevalence among individuals with Orcadian ancestry—20 out of 2,090 ORCADES volunteers carried it, indicating a carrier frequency of approximately 1%, which is about 480-fold greater than that observed in the UK Biobank participants. Furthermore, the analysis showed that the allele frequency warranted consideration for population screening for the BRCA1 V1736A founder mutation in Orcadian women, specifically targeting those with ancestry from the Isle of Westray.
title: Clinical case study meets population cohort: Identification of a BRCA1 pathogenic founder variant in Orcadians

finding: This missense variant in ASPSCR1 was connected with SHS-PC1 and was observed to regulate GLUT4, implicating metabolic pathways in sleep duration and health.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of composite sleep health scores in 413,904 individuals

finding: Variant rs6505162 in the MIR423 gene demonstrated a significant association with the susceptibility to rheumatoid arthritis among the Pakistani population. The co-dominant model data revealed a significant increase in C/C and A/C genotypes in RA cases compared to healthy controls, with a P value of 0.0009, indicating that this variant is a risk factor for RA.
title: Investigation of Association Between microRNA Variants and Risk of Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: The SNP rs59443763 mapped to the locus 17q24.2 and was associated with another significant glycemic locus. It had a p-value of 1.4 × 10<sup>−8</sup> in the analysis.
title: Characterizing common and rare variations in non-traditional glycemic biomarkers using multivariate approaches on multi-ancestry ARIC study

finding: The SNP rs35763415 was found to have regulatory effects and mapped to the polycomb sequence class associated with repressive gene expression activity. It was an intronic SNP located in the PDE6G gene and was confirmed through the DeepSEA model as having a maximum disease impact score (DIS) greater than 2, indicating likely disease-associated mutations.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The variant rs78378222 was identified in the 3' UTR of the gene TP53, where it displayed associations with both ER-negative and ER-positive breast cancer in opposing directions. This association was statistically significant, reaching a P-value of less than 10^-6. These findings underscored the potential importance of this SNP in influencing breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Analysis of variants in untranslated and promoter regions and breast cancer risk using whole genome sequencing data

finding: Identified in proximity to the BPTF gene, rs2080090 was significantly associated with Long COVID (OR=0.95, p=1.36X10^-08) and was linked to multiple genes suggestive of immune involvement.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: The study reported findings related to the APOE genotype with a specific focus on the SNP rs239358, indicating its association with APOE-ε4 carrier status. This finding was significant in the context of dementia risk, as the presence of the APOE-ε4 allele was strongly associated with an increased likelihood of developing dementia.
title: Association between anticholinergic burden and dementia in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs199439 was part of the shared loci that have been associated with PTSD through the conjFDR analysis, and it was noted to have a CADD score suggesting its relevance in neural response to trauma.
title: The genetic relationships between post-traumatic stress disorder and its corresponding neural circuit structures

finding: This SNP was shown to map to the MAPT gene and indicated strong evidence (H4 of 99%) for shared genetic liability between autism and education attainment.
title: Exploring autism and autism co-occurring condition associations to elucidate multivariate genetic mechanisms and insights

finding: This SNP, annotated to GDPD1, was identified as significant at a genome-wide level for self-reported pack years of smoking with a heritability of 27.3%. This finding indicates its association with smoking behavior, particularly within self-reported measures.
title: Blood- and brain-based genome-wide association studies of smoking

finding: Findings for rs77548999 demonstrated a positive association with angina, with an OR<sub>IVW</sub> of 1.005, 95% CI from 1.003 to 1.007, and a p-value <0.001, reinforcing its role in angina risk.
title: Causality of Genetically Determined Monounsaturated Fatty Acids on Risk of Cardiovascular Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs62055696 was found to be significant among female samples related to PA, also retaining its significance in the combined sample.
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: This SNP was reported as a lead SNP for neuroticism with a highly significant p-value, highlighting its importance in the genetic architecture related to this trait.
title: A genome-wide investigation into the underlying genetic architecture of personality traits and overlap with psychopathology

finding: This SNP was noted to be significantly associated with neuroticism in the context of eQTL analysis, showcasing its potential role in modulating gene expression related to personality.
title: A genome-wide investigation into the underlying genetic architecture of personality traits and overlap with psychopathology

finding: Identified as an eQTL SNP, it was significantly associated with neuroticism, indicating its involvement in the genetic basis of this personality trait.
title: A genome-wide investigation into the underlying genetic architecture of personality traits and overlap with psychopathology

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with neuroticism in eQTL studies, contributing evidence to the genetic underpinnings of this trait.
title: A genome-wide investigation into the underlying genetic architecture of personality traits and overlap with psychopathology

finding: Like the others in this group, this SNP was identified as significantly associated with neuroticism through eQTL analysis, further adding to the genetic associations of this trait.
title: A genome-wide investigation into the underlying genetic architecture of personality traits and overlap with psychopathology

finding: The lead variant rs1863115 was a non-synonymous exonic variant for LRRC37A2 and an intronic variant for ARL17A, associated with a p-value of 2.47 × 10^−10. This variant was linked to synaptic function and mean reaction time, indicating its importance in the genetic basis of RTV.
title: Genome-wide association study in 404,302 individuals identifies 7 significant loci for reaction time variability

finding: This SNP showed significant eQTL effects on CHRNB1 with implications in the cholinergic system in Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The SNP rs62057121 was reported with a significant association to PSP, showing a p-value of 7.45 × 10^-78 and a beta value of -1.32, indicating its relevance within the MAPT region.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs242561, located in an enhancer region influencing MAPT transcription, exhibited a significant association with PSP (p = 4.49 × 10^-74), demonstrating a beta value of -1.23.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs242557 demonstrated genome-wide significance adjusted for the H1/H2 haplotype with a p-value of 3.68 × 10^-15.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The alternative allele in homozygosis for rs8065903, mapping to the gene SPATA20, was also associated with the noFAST phenotype. This SNP showed a notably higher proportion of subjects carrying the reference allele in homozygosis in the FAST group, suggesting it may contribute to slower renal progression compared to those with the FAST phenotype.
title: IDENTIFICATION OF MODIFIER GENE VARIANTS OVERREPRESENTED IN FAMILIAL HYPOMAGNESEMIA WITH HYPERCALCIURIA AND NEPHROCALCINOSIS PATIENTS WITH A MORE AGGRESSIVE RENAL PHENOTYPE

finding: The SNP rs553874586 was identified as a novel locus associated with the onset age of smoking. Located in the MMD gene on chromosome 17, it demonstrated a beta value of -3.77 (SE = 0.654) with genome-wide significance (P = 8.08 × 10^-9). This finding indicated that the SNP was significantly related to the age at which individuals initiated smoking.
title: Evaluation of the Causal Relationship Between Smoking and Schizophrenia in Asia

finding: The SNP rs34210653, associated with a p.Thr560Met mutation in ALOX15, was found to protect against nasal polyps, showing a P-value of 2×10^-15.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs113171849 was associated with RBS-R stereotyped at a p-value of 1.7 × 10^-7. It is an intronic SNP of RBFOX3, a splicing factor strongly expressed in the brain that is implicated in autism and cognitive impairment.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The SNP rs79146782 was associated with RBS-R injurious with a p-value of 4 × 10^-7. It is located in an intron of the ASIC2 gene, which is involved in sodium channel activity and has associations with autism.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The SNP rs78378222, associated with the TP53 gene, was significantly linked to mLOX with an OR of 1.16 and a P-value of 3.3 x 10^-10. The effect size varied across biobanks due to differences in mLOX cell fractions, further illustrating its role in mLOX susceptibility.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The C allele of rs78378222 was associated with lower expression of wild-type TP53 and was linked to poorer overall survival due to reduced p53 activity.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The minor allele of rs17884306 was associated with higher TMB and lower expression of the TP53 gene.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The 3' UTR variant in TP53 (rs78378222, T>G) was associated with a 40% reduction in odds of developing overall head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.62 (95% CI: 0.52, 0.73), p=2.16×10^-8. This variant also demonstrated strong evidence of being an eQTL correlated with decreased expression of the TP53 gene.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: Notably, the splice variant rs55831773 mapping to ATP1B2 was found to increase the risk of LA with an OR of 1.21 (95% CI: 1.13, 1.29; p=5.1×10^-9).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: This SNP was linked with a splice acceptor variant in GSDMB that affected its functioning, relating directly to cervical cancer mechanisms.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs3027172, specifically the PER1 genotype, was identified as interacting with early life stress, which was predictive of problematic alcohol use. This finding was significant in the context of understanding genetic contributions to alcohol use disorder (AUD), indicating that the effects of early life stress on alcohol consumption patterns could be moderated by genetic predispositions.
title: A single-nucleus transcriptomics study of alcohol use disorder in the nucleus accumbens

finding: The SNP rs11570508 was significantly associated with general congenital heart defects (CHD) in the FinnGen study, demonstrating a beta value of 0.24 and P = 1.2×10^-11. It was further linked to the expression of the genes MYL4 and KPNB1, with eQTL analysis revealing associations of these genes in heart tissues.
title: Genomic and transcriptomic data analyses highlight KPNB1 and MYL4 as novel risk genes for congenital heart disease

finding: The SNP rs1293973611 was significantly linked to septal defects, with a beta value of 4.96 and P = 1.1×10^-8, and was found to be enriched in the Finnish population.
title: Genomic and transcriptomic data analyses highlight KPNB1 and MYL4 as novel risk genes for congenital heart disease

finding: Similar to rs9264393, rs80093687 was noted to feature significant phenotypic associations, reflecting its connection to various health traits, especially related to blood metrics.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs78378222 exhibited significant associations across multiple health traits, signifying its potential influence on relevant phenotypes in clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The rare variant rs754853158 (missense in NEURL4) was identified as increasing risk in TP53-CHIP with an odds ratio of 1284 (P = 4.63 x 10^-17), indicating its significant role in this subtype.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The lead variant rs36082764 at the LINC00511 locus demonstrated a significant association with axial motor presentation, with a Beta of -0.62 and a P-value of 6.3e-8.
title: Association of genetic variation at the GJA5/ACP6 locus with motor progression in Parkinson’s

finding: The rs113282988 variant, located in the ITGAE gene, demonstrated significant interactions with Traumatic and Stressful Life Events (TSLEs) and Trauma Risk Scores (TRS), indicating its role in PTSD susceptibility. This finding reached genome-wide significance with a beta coefficient greater than 0.056 and a p-value less than 3.28x10^-9.
title: Disentangling the roles of trauma and genetics in psychiatric disorders using an Electronic Health Records-based approach

finding: SHBG rs1799941 interacted with sex on testosterone levels, replicating prior identified effects.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The SNP rs60380775 was associated with stroke of any mechanism as part of the study conducted by TOPMed, specifically linked to the gene RAP1GAP2 and driven by rare variants.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Analyses Support a Role of Vitamin D Metabolism in Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs11079993 was a new identification linked to the chronic back pain phenomenon, specifically associated with SGIT, and participant in gene prioritization efforts that suggested a possible involvement of the CA10 gene in pain mechanisms.
title: Decomposing the genetic background of chronic back pain

finding: The previously reported variant rs7222178 was nominally significant in Asian Veterans and highlighted potential directionality in association with osteoarthritis (OA), despite strand-related challenges.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2628315 was associated with breast cancer risk, where the G allele showed preferential expression in cases compared to controls, indicating a significant linear relationship with cancer risk. It was discovered to be in complete LD with the risk variant rs2787486, suggesting that higher expression of this allele correlates with increased cancer risk.
title: Germline Allelic Expression of Genes at 17q22 Locus Associates with Risk of Breast Cancer

finding: The SNP rs17817901 was found to show significant differential allelic expression patterns, with the A allele being preferentially expressed in breast cancer cases. It was linked to the nearby risk-associated variant rs2787486, suggesting a potential regulatory role influencing breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Germline Allelic Expression of Genes at 17q22 Locus Associates with Risk of Breast Cancer

finding: The SNP rs8066588 was identified as a cis-regulatory variant affecting gene expression in breast tissue, particularly associated with COX11. It exhibited functionality as an eQTL and was shown to alter the binding affinity of transcription factors, contributing to breast cancer risk.
title: Germline Allelic Expression of Genes at 17q22 Locus Associates with Risk of Breast Cancer

finding: The SNP rs6504950 demonstrated an association with breast cancer risk, with a per-allele odds ratio indicating a negative correlation with disease presence, reinforcing its potential role in cancer susceptibility.
title: Germline Allelic Expression of Genes at 17q22 Locus Associates with Risk of Breast Cancer

finding: The SNP rs2787486 was established as a lead risk variant for breast cancer in the studied locus, presenting a strong association with disease susceptibility in three independent studies, and it was shown to modify the expression of neighboring genes.
title: Germline Allelic Expression of Genes at 17q22 Locus Associates with Risk of Breast Cancer

finding: In 17q24.2, the SNP rs4791212 was connected with overall macular thickness (overall_macular_thickness_right) and the mean MO of the inferior fronto-occipital fasciculus (IFO_MO), exhibiting a high posterior probability of shared causal variants (PPH4 = 0.963).
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12451721, linked to IFO_MO, was also part of the shared genetic influences found in 17q24.2 between retinal and brain traits.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs6503451 located on chromosome 17 was associated with left ventricular mass index (LVMI) and resulted in notable connections to the gene LRRC37A, which was previously linked to cardiac features in other studies.
title: Clinical and Genetic Associations of Deep Learning-Derived Cardiac Magnetic Resonance-Based Left Ventricular Mass

finding: SNP rs199502, also on chromosome 17, was significantly associated with LVMI and located 914kb apart from rs6503451, with evidence suggesting a shared genetic signal related to cardiac contractility.
title: Clinical and Genetic Associations of Deep Learning-Derived Cardiac Magnetic Resonance-Based Left Ventricular Mass

finding: SNP rs2301369 near the NOS2 gene was associated with anterior uveitis (OR = 1.08, p = 3.9 x 10^-8), indicating its relevance in inflammatory responses.
title: Genome-wide association study of anterior uveitis

finding: SNP rs4969391, located in the exonic region of the BAIAP2 gene, was part of the novel anxiety loci discovered, but no specific details regarding its functional implication were provided.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The variant rs80357880, corresponding to a frameshift insertion p.L655Ffs*10 in exon 9 of BRCA1, was identified as pathogenic in one breast cancer patient within a cohort of 16 Chilean women diagnosed with breast cancer. This variant is classified as pathogenic in ClinVar and is associated with hereditary breast and ovarian cancer. Furthermore, it was classified as likely oncogenic with a Level 1 evidence classification in the OncoKB database, marking it as an FDA-recognized biomarker that predicts response to several FDA-approved drugs, including PARP inhibitors.
title: A workflow for clinical profiling of BRCA genes in Chilean breast cancer patients via targeted sequencing

finding: The variant rs3809863 was found to be significantly associated with astigmatism and open-angle glaucoma. It was located within the genic region of ITGB3 and THCAT158, and showed robust transcription activity in brain tissues such as the frontal cortex and hippocampus. This variant's association with intraocular pressure elevation linked it to glaucoma's progression, while its proximity to non-coding RNA THCAT158 suggested potential implications in both myopia and astigmatism.
title: A novel computational methodology for GWAS multi-locus analysis based on graph theory and machine learning

finding: The RNF213 p.R4810K variant (rs112735431) was found to be significantly associated with intracranial vessel wall enhancement (VWE) and poor prognosis in moyamoya disease (MMD), demonstrating an odds ratio (OR) of 2.01, indicating that it was a risk factor for VWE in MMD patients.
title: Clinical and genetic risk factors and long-term outcomes of MRI vessel wall enhancement in moyamoya disease

finding: The rs67143157 variant in ASGR1 was identified to associate with Endoglin plasma levels (p = 1.83 x 10^-8) and indicated a correlation with plasma levels of Urokinase Receptor, further supporting its biological significance.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs3933469 variant in the SOX15-SAT2 locus associated with oestradiol-F levels (β = 0.0363, P = 1.02E-12), suggesting its potential role in female fertility dynamics.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The variant rs2011959 located downstream of CCL3 was connected to Covid-19 severity in men. It exhibited an OR of 1.34 and P-value of 6.50×10⁻⁶.
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The rs142653327 variant was identified as a novel pQTL for Gal-9, which is associated with inflammatory pathways yet not previously found in European populations.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: This secondary association for Gal-9 was also significant in Greenland but related to different pQTLs as compared to UK Biobank.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: The SNP rs1819040 near KANSL1 had eight associated phenotypes including atrial fibrillation (OR 1.07, 95% CI 1.04-1.10, q=0.0084) and pulmonary fibrosis (OR 0.80, 95% CI 0.71-0.89, q=0.035). These results indicated a link between the A risk allele and various cardiac and pulmonary conditions.
title: A Phenome Wide Association Study of Severe COVID-19 Genetic Risk Variants

finding: The missense variant rs72553883 in the TNFRSF13B gene was significantly associated with spleen volume, showing an effect of 0.025 L and an effect size of 0.37 standard deviations (s.d.), with a P-value of 5.6 × 10^-19. This gene is known for its role in common variable immunodeficiency, where mutations can lead to splenomegaly.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The missense variant rs34557412, also within TNFRSF13B, was linked to spleen volume with an effect of 0.028 L and an effect size of 0.42 s.d., achieving a striking P-value of 2.0 × 10^-28, the top association among the variant-level analyses.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The missense SNV in ERBB2, identified as rs369903296 (Arg599Cys), was found in three unrelated probands with left ventricular outflow tract obstruction (LVOTO) defects. It was reported to segregate with the condition in familial cases, suggesting a strong association. The study noted the presence of the variant in all affected family members but also identified some unaffected carriers, indicating reduced penetrance of the mutation.
title: ERBB2 R599C variant is associated with left ventricular outflow tract obstruction defects in human

finding: The SNP rs1459062246, located near HOXB2, was noted as a common variant associated with venous thromboembolism, implicating structural variant involvement in the disease's genomic architecture.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The intronic variant rs11079650 showed a strong association with heart failure and is located within the <italic>PRKCA</italic> gene. Functional studies indicated that rs9912468, in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs11079650, activated <italic>PRKCA</italic> expression in the left ventricle, suggesting a cardiac enhancer role, and prior studies had linked this locus to electrocardiographic measures of left ventricular mass.
title: Multi-ancestry Multivariate Genome-Wide Analysis Highlights the Role of Common Genetic Variation in Cardiac Structure, Function, and Heart Failure-related Traits

finding: The variant rs9912468 served as a <italic>cis-</italic>eQTL for the <italic>PRKCA</italic> gene and was noted in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs11079650. It demonstrated association with <italic>PRKCA</italic> expression in the human left ventricle, supporting its relevance in heart failure.
title: Multi-ancestry Multivariate Genome-Wide Analysis Highlights the Role of Common Genetic Variation in Cardiac Structure, Function, and Heart Failure-related Traits

finding: A variant was identified in the promoter region of GAA, located 182 bps upstream of the transcription start site, identified in trans with a nonsense variant in a patient with a phenotype consistent with limb girdle muscular dystrophy (LGMD). Although in silico scores suggested it was unlikely to be deleterious, biochemical assays confirmed marked deficiency of GAA enzymatic activity in the patient, leading to a diagnosis of Pompe disease.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: A nonsense variant was identified in GAA as part of the same case mentioned above. This variant was associated with the patient's diagnosis of Pompe disease.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: An intronic 5'UTR variant was found in GAA, reported pathogenic in ClinVar. This variant was shown to impact splicing and was identified in cis with the promoter variant in the proband. It is commonly observed in Pompe disease cases and tends to cause later-onset symptoms.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: This SNP was among those confirmed to show nominally significant associations with pancreatic cancer in the study.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs8081059 was associated with an increased risk of renal cell carcinoma, highlighting its significance in cancer risk related to ZIP11.
title: Single nucleotide polymorphisms and Zn transport by nuclear ZIP11 shape cancer phenotypes in HeLa cells

finding: The SNP rs11871756 was linked to an increased risk of bladder cancer, suggesting a role in the disease associated with ZIP11 variant expression.
title: Single nucleotide polymorphisms and Zn transport by nuclear ZIP11 shape cancer phenotypes in HeLa cells

finding: The SNP rs11077654 was related to bladder cancer risk, indicating its potential impact on ZIP11 functionality in oncogenesis.
title: Single nucleotide polymorphisms and Zn transport by nuclear ZIP11 shape cancer phenotypes in HeLa cells

finding: The SNP rs9913017 was connected to bladder cancer risk, reinforcing the association of ZIP11 variants with carcinogenic processes.
title: Single nucleotide polymorphisms and Zn transport by nuclear ZIP11 shape cancer phenotypes in HeLa cells

finding: The SNP rs4969054 was also linked to bladder cancer risk, demonstrating the relevance of genetic variations in ZIP11 to cancer susceptibility.
title: Single nucleotide polymorphisms and Zn transport by nuclear ZIP11 shape cancer phenotypes in HeLa cells

finding: The SNP rs10278 on chromosome 17 was identified by the univariate gge test in relation to HDL cholesterol levels. However, it did not represent an independent locus as it was in linkage disequilibrium with other significant SNPs.
title: A multivariate approach to joint testing of main genetic and gene-environment interaction effects

finding: The study by Li et al. (2018) found that polymorphism rs1052536 in a Base Excision Repair gene was identified as a risk factor for neural tube defects (NTDs) in China, linking genetic variants to folate metabolism and DNA repair mechanisms particularly under conditions relevant to neural tube development.
title: Folate deficiency facilitates coordination of KDM6A with p53 in response to DNA damage

finding: A higher expression level of ERN1 in monocytes was associated with the AS risk allele G at SNP rs196941. This finding indicated a genetic connection between the allele and the hyper-responsiveness of trained monocytes in individuals with Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS), linking the SNP to disease pathology.
title: Trained immunity in human monocyte enhances myeloid-T-cell pathogenic crosstalk in Ankylosing Spondylitis

finding: This SNP was found within the intron of the WNT3 gene, which was associated with cognitive function. It exceeded the log10 Bayes factor threshold (B10 = 2.64), indicating considerable evidence of causality.
title: Identification of 13 independent genetic loci associated with cognitive resilience in healthy aging in 330,097 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs7210937 SNP in hsa-miR-1269b was associated with breast cancer risk factors and was determined to have a significant correlation with gene expression variation.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: The rs12451747 SNP was distinguished for its significant association with cancer risk factors, particularly breast and gastric cancers.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: The rs8079075 variant was highlighted at chromosome 17q12, significantly reducing the candidate causal variant set from 249 to one, identifying the rs112569955 risk allele which increased enhancer activity by 36% compared to its non-risk allele.
title: Genome-wide discovery of SLE genetic risk variant allelic enhancer activity

finding: The rs112569955 variant was mentioned specifically as the risk allele at locus 17q12, which demonstrated 36% increased enhancer activity compared to the non-risk allele, emphasizing its importance in SLE risk.
title: Genome-wide discovery of SLE genetic risk variant allelic enhancer activity

finding: The SNP rs63751273 was associated with an autosomal dominant mutation P301L in a female individual in her 50s, which was linked to frontotemporal dementia (FTD). The NPC line MGH-2046-RC1 derived from this individual was utilized for research involving the regulation of miR-132, indicating a potential genetic basis for neurodegenerative phenotypes observed in Tauopathies.
title: Small Molecule Inducers of Neuroprotective miR-132 Identified by HTS-HTS in Human iPSC-derived Neurons

finding: The SNP rs63751273 was associated with an autosomal dominant mutation linked to Frontotemporal Dementia (FTD) in an individual in her 50s. This mutation, tau-P301L (c.C1907T), is scientifically significant as it contributes to the pathophysiology observed in neurodegenerative conditions, impacting tau-related neuronal stress and contributing to the aggregation of tau protein, a key feature being targeted by autophagy activators like CCT020312.
title: mTOR inhibitor-independent Autophagy Activator Ameliorates Tauopathy and Prionopathy Neurodegeneration Phenotypes

finding: The MAPT haplotype associated with risk of Parkinson's disease was included in the findings, marking its potential significance in neurodegenerative disease risk assessment.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: This intron variant in RPTOR was significantly associated with body fat percentage and weight in a study involving a cohort of 214 Malagasy individuals. This variant was found to segregate at a low frequency (∼3%) in African populations and was unobserved in other 1000 Genomes populations, indicating it is unique to populations with admixed African ancestry.
title: Whole-genome Studies of Malagasy People Uncover Novel Body Composition Associations

finding: This variant was highlighted in two distinguishable modifier effects on chromosome 17, associated with increased somatic expansion.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: Tagged with increased somatic expansion (17ABEM1) in the ATAD5 region, showing notable significance (p=4.91E-09).
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: Captured as part of a second modifier effect (17ABEM2) along with rs62070643, yielding a p-value of 8.50E-08.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs36069870 was a positive original finding associated with exon levels of SUMO2 and colocalized with GWAS variants for sex hormone binding globulin levels.
title: Disentangling genetic effects on transcriptional and post-transcriptional gene regulation through integrating exon and intron expression QTLs

finding: This SNP related to SLC39A11 (ZIP11), a zinc transporter with links to multiple cancers, particularly glioma.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: For rs9893132, it was noted as a fine-mapped SNP associated with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE). The SNP was located in an enhancer regulated by SP1 and NFKb2, linking to the non-coding RNA MALAT1 and gene cathepsin W (CTSW) within the primed macrophage eGRN. This SNP was implicated as targeting MALAT1, which has been associated with SLE, emphasizing its relevance in autoimmune disease mechanisms.
title: GRaNIE and GRaNPA: Inference and evaluation of enhancer-mediated gene regulatory networks applied to study macrophages

finding: The SNP rs7214041, associated with pancreatic cancer, was confirmed positively in the study, contributing to the replication of GWAS hits.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: The SNP rs11655237 was confirmed as significantly associated with pancreatic cancer risk, replicated successfully in this study.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: The SNP rs7212610 was associated with the long intergenic non-protein coding RNA LINC02073. It achieved the highest posterior probabilities for G×T interactions in both log-NL and log-LM analyses, indicating a significant response to treatment with a reduction in genotype effect size that was captured more reliably by log-NL.
title: Probabilistic classification of gene-by-treatment interactions on molecular count phenotypes

finding: For the SNP rs4796224, associated with the ZNHIT3 gene known for its role in severe encephalopathy, the posterior probability for crossover interaction was nearly one, indicating a robust and significant genetic interaction that alters treatment response.
title: Probabilistic classification of gene-by-treatment interactions on molecular count phenotypes

finding: At the MAPT locus (rs4792897), associated with neurodegenerative disorders, a strong selection signal was detected, indicating significant evolutionary pressures over time.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: In the analysis of SNP rs8070723 within the 17q21.31 region containing the MAPT gene, a high Jaccard similarity score of 0.94 was observed between H2-carrier status (H1H2+H2H2) and the presence of an identified duplication. Logistic regression analysis indicated a high predictive accuracy of 97% for the existence of a duplication when using H2-carrier status as the feature, with an AUC of 0.95. This was tested on a sample set of 146 with the observed duplication and 85 without, yielding only 6 false positives and no false negatives.
title: CNV-Finder: Streamlining Copy Number Variation Discovery

finding: The rs121912656 variant (G245D) in the TP53 gene was recognized as pathogenic and was associated with various cancers as part of the Li-Fraumeni syndrome. This designation stemmed from the understanding that TP53 is the most commonly mutated gene in cancer.
title: An efficient and adaptable workflow for editing disease-relevant single nucleotide variants using CRISPR/Cas9

finding: The rs11540652 variant (R248Q) in the TP53 gene was also identified as pathogenic, contributing to a heterogeneous range of cancers within the framework of Li-Fraumeni syndrome.
title: An efficient and adaptable workflow for editing disease-relevant single nucleotide variants using CRISPR/Cas9

finding: The rs78378222 variant, located in the 3'-UTR of the TP53 gene, had predicted deleterious effects (CADD = 15.93) and was associated with the p53 signaling pathway, known for its role in cell cycle regulation and apoptosis. This association emphasized the involvement of the p53 pathway in cranial growth, linking genetic variation in this locus to processes influencing both normal and malignant neural cell populations.
title: Genetic variants for head size share genes and pathways with cancer

finding: rs7225002 was involved in significant associations with white matter microstructure traits, particularly those measuring MD.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: This SNP had strong effects on white matter structures like the corpus callosum and was linked to multiple psychiatric and neurological disorders.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The SNP rs2246577 was identified as a notable eQTL located in the DBS of <italic>FN3KRP</italic>. It exhibited high derived allele frequencies (DAFs) in all three modern human populations (CEU, CHB, YRI) and showed a positive eQTL effect size of 0.5 or greater across 44 out of 48 GTEx tissues, indicating its significant role in gene expression.
title: Human-specific lncRNAs contributed critically to human evolution by distinctly regulating gene expression

finding: SNP rs882367 was identified as genome-wide significant in the UKB and successfully replicated in the meta-analysis of SHR-associated loci, demonstrating its relevance to sitting height ratio (SHR).
title: Genetics of skeletal proportions in two different populations

finding: SNP rs2305480 was associated with sQTL interactions in the GSDMB gene within lung tissues, influencing splicing outcomes that are linked with asthma susceptibility. Notably, allele C of this splice acceptor variant was related to exon 6 skipping, which altered functional isoform expression and impacted asthma risk.
title: Identification and analysis of splicing quantitative trait loci across multiple tissues in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs11078928 acted as an sQTL for the GSDMB gene, leading to the skipping of exon 6. The T allele was correlated with increased asthma risk, while the C allele was associated with reduced risk, demonstrating the functional implications of splicing alterations in disease contexts.
title: Identification and analysis of splicing quantitative trait loci across multiple tissues in the human genome

finding: This SNP was identified as an eQTL for the gene ERBB2 specifically in RV-treated airway epithelial cells. The asthma risk allele rs66826786-T was associated with decreased expression of ERBB2 after RV infection, indicating a gene regulatory mechanism influenced by DNA methylation levels.
title: Multi-omics co-localization with genome-wide association studies reveals a context-specific genetic mechanism at a childhood onset asthma risk locus

finding: The SNP rs9303566 controlled WFKN2 levels and was associated with DNA methylation, highlighting its regulatory potential.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The SNP rs17608766, identified as the lead SNP for multiple cardiac traits, including aortic root size and blood pressure, overlapped a D2 mesoderm-specific enhancer. It interacted with the promoter of WNT3, which plays a crucial role in cardiac mesoderm induction. Deleting the enhancer containing this SNP resulted in a significant reduction in WNT3 expression.
title: 3D Chromatin Architecture Remodeling during Human Cardiomyocyte Differentiation Reveals A Role Of HERV-H In Demarcating Chromatin Domains

finding: The SNP rs1057519816 was associated with HER2 mutation S310F, which was identified as a germline variation. It played a significant role in the interface with the therapeutic antibody Pertuzumab, affecting drug binding capabilities and thus contributing to drug resistance in breast cancer treatment.
title: Computational Engineering of a Therapeutic Antibody to Inhibit Multiple Mutants of HER2 Without Compromising Inhibition of the Canonical HER2

finding: The SNP rs78378222, located in the 3'-UTR of TP53, was associated with increased height, lean body mass, and basal metabolic rate in a cohort of 500,000. This SNP also validated its associations with brain malignancy (OR=3.12) and non-melanomatous skin cancer (OR=1.46).
title: Heritable genetic variants in key cancer genes link cancer risk with anthropometric traits

finding: The germline variant rs61757955 was identified in the 3' UTR of GRB2 and was associated with a poor prognosis in low grade glioma patients, with a significance of p=7.08E-10 and a hazard ratio of 20.4. This variant was shown to enhance survival models when included with eleven clinical covariates, leading to improved prediction of patient outcomes.
title: The Germline Variants rs61757955 and rs34988193 are Predictive of Survival in Low Grade Glioma Patients

finding: The SNP rs113994160 was associated with a missense mutation in the HES7 gene, specifically the R25W mutation, which resulted in segmentation defects of the vertebrae (SDV). In the Axioloids derived from patient-like iPSC lines carrying this mutation, phenotypic analysis revealed a loss of epithelial somite formation and abnormal rostrocaudal patterning. These findings were consistent with previous reports, demonstrating that the HES7 mutation impacts the segmentation process in vertebrate development.
title: Reconstituting human somitogenesis in vitro

finding: The SNP rs936394 demonstrated allele-specific effects on binding and was among those tested in detail, showing significant differences in transcriptional regulation consistent with its role in SLE pathogenesis.
title: High-throughput identification of functional regulatory SNPs in systemic lupus erythematosus

finding: Finally, rs9907966 was found to be a significant variant with potential regulatory effects in the context of systemic lupus erythematosus, confirmed through experimental assays.
title: High-throughput identification of functional regulatory SNPs in systemic lupus erythematosus

finding: The rs6565653 variant in the SLC26A11 gene was associated with young onset ischemic stroke in a Caucasian population, as evidenced by suggestive p-values in a genome-wide association study. Notably, it was found to tag the RNF213 rs12944088 p.H4691R variant, which had a higher frequency among subjects with intracranial aneurysms compared to healthy controls.
title: RNF213 variation, a broader role in neurovascular disease in Caucasian and Japanese populations

finding: Like rs6565653, rs12601526 also showed suggestive association with young onset ischemic stroke in Caucasian populations, with a significant p-value indicating its relevance in cerebrovascular phenotypes.
title: RNF213 variation, a broader role in neurovascular disease in Caucasian and Japanese populations

finding: The RNF213 rs12944088 (p.H4691R) variant was suggested to be more common among individuals with intracranial aneurysms, indicating its potential contribution to increased risk of neurovascular disorders.
title: RNF213 variation, a broader role in neurovascular disease in Caucasian and Japanese populations

finding: The rs55851803 SNP was linked to a C64Y mutation in the BRCA1 gene, classified as Pathogenic in ClinVar. This mutation was shown to disrupt E3 ubiquitin ligase activity, leading to a significant decrease in read representation from day 7 to day 21 post-transduction in a screening environment.
title: Massively parallel assessment of human variants with base editor screens

finding: The variant rs121918404 was identified as a well-genotyped heterozygous variant with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.004% in the UK Biobank study. The analysis indicated that this variant was accurately genotyped, suggesting a high confidence in its identification through the SNP-chip testing.
title: Very rare pathogenic genetic variants detected by SNP-chips are usually false positives: implications for direct-to-consumer genetic testing

finding: The variant rs80357065 was found to be a poorly genotyped heterozygous variant with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.0007% in the UK Biobank. The study highlighted that this variant illustrated the challenges associated with genotyping rare variants, as the SNP-chip's performance dropped significantly with decreasing allele frequency, resulting in a high false discovery rate.
title: Very rare pathogenic genetic variants detected by SNP-chips are usually false positives: implications for direct-to-consumer genetic testing

finding: In the fine mapping of ACE, rs4292 was identified as a putatively causal eSNP located in the ACE promoter, which exhibited a strong open chromatin status across multiple cell types, predominantly in proximal tubules, aligning with the gene's expression pattern.
title: Mapping genomic regulation of kidney disease and traits through high-resolution and interpretable eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs370739771 was identified as significant for post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) with HMP values of 0.04 for CT and 0.02 for SA, indicating its influence on regional brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Associated with SCZ, rs7225002 had an HMP of 2.18×10<sup>-5</sup> for CT and 1.11×10<sup>-5</sup> for SA, reflecting its involvement in the structural brain phenotype.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: For SCZ, rs55938136 was linked with CT (HMP=3.28×10<sup>-4</sup>) and SA (HMP=7.08×10<sup>-5</sup>), indicating its role in brain morphological changes.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Associated with increased CT in ASD, rs56305452 contributes to understanding structural variations in the brain.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure
