finding: The protein-truncating variant (PTV) rs80356487 (p.Q347X) was associated with fasting glucose (FG) levels, indicating its impact on glycemic regulation.
title: Tissue-Specific Alteration of Metabolic Pathways Influences Glycemic Regulation

finding: The rs9747347 variant in the <italic>TSPAN10</italic> gene was significantly associated with both myopia and pigmentation, particularly showing a strong association with hair color. This variant was favored by selection in European populations for its association with myopia, indicating a potential link between local adaptation to light environments and myopia prevalence.
title: Detection of adaptation to light environment in myopia-associated loci Diversity of the myopia genetic background

finding: The index SNP rs11655029 had a significant association with educational attainment (EA) with a p-value of 2.84 × 10^-9, falling in an intron of the gene RAI1, which has previously shown to be dosage-sensitive with implications for autism spectrum disorder (ASD). It indicated a peak signal for the association with EA, underpinning its relevance.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The index SNP rs4244599 showed a modest association with ASD (p-value = 0.0018) and was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene TOM1L2. This indicated that although it was not strongly associated with ASD, it played a role in regulating gene expression related to the phenotype.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The index SNP rs8082590 exhibited a robust association with schizophrenia (SCZ), having a p-value of 6.02 × 10^-8, and was linked to the smoothed signal for association over the gene GID4. This result conformed to traditional GWAS significance thresholds.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The index SNP rs74998289 had a significant association with educational attainment (EA), exceeding standard GWAS significance thresholds with a p-value of 1.31 × 10^-17. This SNP is an eSNP for KANSL1 and indicates its potential influence on cognitive function.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The SNP rs12942300 approached a significant association with ASD (p-value = 2.06 × 10^-6). It was located within a known inversion polymorphism region on chromosome 17, implicating the region in neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The rs2474694 A allele was shown to contribute to an increased risk of prostate cancer, with a significant association to higher VPS53 expression in BPH1 and DU145 cells. Functional assays indicated that the G allele exhibited stronger transcriptional activity than the A allele, supporting its role as a regulatory variant.
title: Identify Regulatory eQTLs by Multiome Sequencing in Prostate Single Cells

finding: The SNP rs9895127 was the index SNP at locus 17q24.3, related to varicose veins, and was found in moderate linkage disequilibrium with other relevant SNPs.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs17608766 had the strongest GWAS association for pulmonary root diameter (P = 1.9E-51), located near the GOSR2 gene. This highlighted its critical role in pulmonary structure, linking it with pathways involved in the heart.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: The SNP rs2526377, located intronically in TSPOAP1, showed a significant association with the hsa-miR-6761-3p gene set in oligodendrocyte precursor cells (OPCs), noted with a p-value of 5.90×10⁻⁴. This microRNA has also been previously linked to Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: gsQTL: Associating genetic risk variants with gene sets by exploiting their shared variability

finding: The variant rs11658786 was predicted to alter a SPI1 binding site in the gene STARD3. AMBER-Seq predicted that the A allele significantly reduces SPI1 binding, while the G allele demonstrated predominant binding (85.2%). This prediction was supported by independent ChIP-seq experiments. Additionally, it was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for STARD3, with the G genotype showing higher expression compared to the A genotype. Further analysis confirmed strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with significant GWAS loci related to high cholesterol.
title: An automated framework for efficiently designing deep convolutional neural networks in genomics

finding: This SNP also presented suggestive evidence for interaction (p=4.61×10−7), spanning multiple genes including ZNF385C.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The variant rs62061845 in KANSL1 was linked to functional connectivity within the default mode and salience networks and showed relevance to neurodegenerative disorders like Parkinson’s disease.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: Similar to rs529866, the locus containing STAT3 also exhibited co-localization of accessible chromatin regions with IBD risk variants in both macrophages and fibroblasts. However, unlike LITAF, the accessible region for STAT3 was not context-dependent in macrophages or fibroblasts but was robustly detected across various subpopulations.
title: Accessible chromatin maps of inflammatory bowel disease intestine nominate cell-type mediators of genetic disease risk

finding: This SNP, part of the MTRNR2L1-LOC105371703-MIR4522 locus, was associated with the genus Eggerthia and regulated expression in brain cerebellar hemispheres and testes. It had a significant p-value of 8.85 × 10^-12, linking it to traits such as serum testosterone levels.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: It was linked to altered expression levels of ZNF232, primarily indicated through a genotype-based association.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs1800371, a missense variant in the TP53 gene, was found in patient A12 and has been shown to impair p53 function when only one mutated allele is retained. This finding is significant as it relates to the cancer progression since clonal loss of TP53 was identified in the study, consistent with previous pan-cancer research indicating that TP53 is commonly lost or inactivated early during cancer development.
title: HATCHet2: clone- and haplotype-specific copy number inference from bulk tumor sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs55714927 was identified as a pleiotropic synonymous variant in the gene ASGR1. It was shown to act as both a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) and an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) while colocalizing with a naturally variable exon (NVE). This common variant, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 15%, was found to increase the inclusion of an unannotated NVE, which has implications for phenotypes related to cholesterol and heart function. The alternate allele correlated with an increase in splicing of the NVE by between 3 and 10%, contrasting with the reference allele which had an NVE Ψ value close to 0%. A negative correlation was also observed between the Ψ of the NVE and the expression of ASGR1, indicating its potential to trigger nonsense-mediated decay (NMD).
title: Widespread naturally variable human exons aid genetic interpretation

finding: The SNP rs35392904 was identified as genome-wide significant associated with periventricular white matter hyperintensities (PVWMH) during the study. Its significance was corroborated as it previously appeared in studies of total white matter hyperintensity (WMH) burden.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: This SNP was highlighted as one of the key genome-wide significant SNPs for both DWMH and PVWMH, confirming its previous associations with total WMH.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: This SNP was part of the significant findings at the 17q25.1 locus relevant to total WMH, solidifying its important role across both DWMH and PVWMH.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: Alongside its associations with total WMH, this SNP was noted for being linked to broader vascular genetics in prior studies.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: This SNP was noted for its associations within the context of both DWMH and PVWMH, reiterating the genetic overlap seen in WMH pathology.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: Similar to rs9894244, this SNP was linked to genes involved in neurodegenerative processes and discussed within the context of eQTLs related to significant findings in brain pathology.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: Identified within a three-way QTL network for MS, rs2273030 was associated with multiple chromatin features and the SHMT1 locus, showcasing its role akin to regulatory components influencing MS.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: In complete LD with rs2273030, rs4925172 was also part of a QTL network analysis, further reinforcing its role in the SHMT1 regulatory landscape related to MS.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: Additionally located in the SHMT1 locus, rs7207666 was reported to have significant involvement in MS's QTL networks.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs75615630 in the PRKCA gene was associated with occasional drinking (OWD). PRKCA is involved in various nervous system processes, including synaptic signaling and memory formation.
title: Genome-wide association study of alcohol consumption in Russian population

finding: The SNP rs7216389 at the ORMDL3 locus was associated with the susceptibility to childhood asthma and virus-induced respiratory wheezing illnesses. This finding highlighted the role of the ORMDL3 gene in these respiratory conditions.
title: ORMDL3 restrains type-I interferon signaling and anti-tumor immunity by promoting RIG-I degradation

finding: Found in an intron of PAFAH1B1, this SNP was associated with conditions like lissencephaly and contributed to reports of fatigue.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The study highlighted rs10278 (p.Pro347Ala) located in the <italic>CALCOCO2</italic> gene as the most likely causal variant within the T2D GWAS locus traditionally cited for <italic>TTLL6</italic>. The gene <italic>CALCOCO2</italic> was linked to type 2 diabetes through its role in regulating insulin content in pancreatic beta cells. A CRISPR screen demonstrated that knockout (KO) of <italic>CALCOCO2</italic> led to decreased insulin content, indicating its crucial role in beta cell function and disease risk.
title: A genome-wide CRISPR screen identifies regulators of beta cell function involved in type 2 diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs2435204-G showed a significant association with reduced white matter surface area and correlated with increased cortical thickness. It tagged the well-known H2 inversion at 17q21.31, linking it to several phenotypes, including neuroticism.
title: Deep learning based brain age prediction uncovers associated sequence variants

finding: The Pro47Ser variant (S47) of p53, documented as rs1800371, was associated with an increased risk for pre-menopausal breast cancer specifically in African American women, demonstrating its significant impact on cancer risk. This variant was prevalent in African-descent populations, occurring in approximately 1% of African Americans and 6% of Africans from sub-Saharan Africa. Furthermore, the S47 variant was linked to increased levels of cysteine and glutathione in cells, as well as defects in the regulation of certain p53 target genes related to ferroptosis sensitivity. It was also noted that S47 mice exhibited a higher incidence of spontaneous cancer, particularly liver cancer.
title: Increased mTOR activity and metabolic efficiency in mouse and human cells containing the African-centric tumor-predisposing p53 variant Pro47Ser

finding: The SNP rs4430796 was identified as having a genetic association with multiple traits. It served as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for MLLT6, linking it to the underlying biological mechanisms related to these traits.
title: Genetic colocalization atlas points to common regulatory sites and genes for hematopoietic traits and hematopoietic contributions to disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs7501939 also showed a genetic association with various traits and was determined to function as an eQTL for ARHGAP23. This finding highlighted its significance in the context of related biological functions.
title: Genetic colocalization atlas points to common regulatory sites and genes for hematopoietic traits and hematopoietic contributions to disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs11077850 on chromosome 17 demonstrated colocalization with retinal edQTLs related to macular telangiectasia (MacTel). This edQTL was associated with increased editing of a site within the <italic>PRCD</italic> transcript, which is relevant for photoreceptor function.
title: The retinal RNA editome is concentrated in photoreceptor-specific genes and genetically linked to vision loss

finding: The SNP rs6504682 was utilized as the primary instrument to reconstruct the LUC7L3 sub-network, indicating its regulatory potential.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The variant rs372467471, located in the UNC13D gene (NM_199242: c.1889C>T, p.A630V), was identified as a homozygous variant in all archaic human genomes. It is associated with hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH), a rare, life-threatening hyper-inflammatory immune disorder characterized by uncontrolled activation of macrophages and T lymphocytes, which leads to multi-organ failure.
title: Did variants in inborn errors of immunity genes contribute to the extinction of Neanderthals?

finding: The variant rs147748627, located in the UNC13D gene (NM_199242: c.2828A>G, p.N943S), was found to be homozygous in all archaic genomes. This variant has been reported in patients with hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH) and like the other UNC13D variant, it potentially increased susceptibility to severe diseases and may have contributed to the extinction of Neanderthals.
title: Did variants in inborn errors of immunity genes contribute to the extinction of Neanderthals?

finding: The rs56014026 SNP, identified as a heterozygous polymorphism in the P32/C1QBP/HABP1 gene, was found to reduce mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation. This finding was particularly relevant in the context of low-grade colorectal carcinomas, suggesting a link between this genetic variation and the metabolic profile of cancer cells.
title: The zebrafish as a new model for studying chaperone-mediated autophagy unveils its role in spermatogenesis

finding: SNP rs76014915 was characterized as an eQTL having significant activity in brain tissues and the tibial nerve, demonstrating tissue-specific regulatory effects.
title: Mechanisms of tissue-specific genetic regulation revealed by latent factors across eQTLs

finding: The rs111653425 variant in the SLC47A1 gene was identified as a missense mutation (p.Ala465Val) that altered amino acid composition in the transmembrane domains of the MATE1 protein. This change led to dysfunction of the MATE1 transporter, resulting in elevated serum creatinine levels and contributing to Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) in the Pakistani cohort studied. The statistical analysis, showing a p-value of 0.03274 and an odds ratio of 3.244, indicated a significant genotypic association between this variant and CKD.
title: Genetic Association of SLC47A1 Gene Variant (17:19571562C >T) and Bioinformatics Analyses of MATE1 Protein in Chronic Kidney Disease Patients of Pakistani Origin

finding: The presence of the rs2632516 variant was linked to Alzheimer's disease susceptibility and identified within the host gene of miR-142, a downregulated miRNA in the BA9 region of AD patients. This polymorphism was found to be located upstream of the miR-142 gene on the negative strand and may influence its transcriptional regulation. Previous studies had indicated that this variant allele was associated with diminished miR-142 expression in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus. The finding underscored its potential relevance in AD pathophysiology, although further research was necessary to elucidate its functional significance.
title: MIRit: an integrative R framework for the identification of impaired miRNA-mRNA regulatory networks in complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs75493593 at the SLC16A11 locus was associated with type 2 diabetes. The overall allele frequency for this SNP was 36%, with population-specific frequencies of 0.1% in African populations, 0.7% in European populations, and 53% in Native Mexican populations. This finding corroborated previous estimates reported by the SIGMA Type 2 Diabetes Consortium.
title: Genotyping, sequencing and analysis of 140,000 adults from the Mexico City Prospective Study

finding: This SNP was associated with self-reported anxiety diagnoses, situated near the AURKB locus, with a p-value of 1.88×10^-8. It represented one of two GWS loci in the analysis of anxiety case-control status.
title: Reproducible Risk Loci and Psychiatric Comorbidities in Anxiety: Results from ~200,000 Million Veteran Program Participants

finding: The SNP rs883871 was identified as an expression QTL (eQTL) for the genes THRA and NR1B1 in a cohort of 162 East Africans. It was found to be FDR-significant in GTEx whole blood, although it was not the lead eSNP. Importantly, this SNP disrupted the core motif for ETS-family transcription factors, indicating its potential role in regulatory functions related to gene expression.
title: The Genetic and Evolutionary Basis of Gene Expression Variation in East Africans

finding: The rs1799752 SNP, associated with the angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) I/D polymorphism, was confirmed to have significant associations with hypertension susceptibility, particularly noted in meta-analyses across Asian, Caucasian, and mixed populations.
title: Mathematical modeling of the influence of ACE I/D polymorphism on blood pressure and antihypertensive therapy

finding: The TP53 SNP, rs78378222, was associated with an increased cancer risk in ER+ breast cancer (ER+BC) and low-grade serous ovarian cancer (LGSOC), but with a decreased cancer risk in ER- breast cancer (ER-BC) and high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC). Its effect on cancer risk was linked to whether tumors harbored wild-type or mutated TP53, as the minor C-allele was more prevalent in TP53 wild-type tumors. Additionally, the minor C-allele was found to correlate with lower p53 expression levels both in blood samples and tumors, suggesting it modulates p53 activity.
title: Germline and somatic genetic variants in the p53 pathway interact to affect cancer risk, progression and drug response

finding: The SNP rs7225151 within the SCIMP locus was detected as a genome-wide significant association with late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD) following the analysis of data from GR@ACE and the IGAP collaborations. It had an OR of 1.11 and a p-value of 1.12 x 10^-8.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: For SNP rs2732703 in the MAPT locus, association with late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD) was reported, primarily driven by APOE e4 non-carriers; however, odds ratio and p-value details were not specified.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: This SNP caused a D1138N mutation in BRIP1, linked to breast cancer.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: This mutation resulted in D1138G in BRIP1, linked to breast cancer.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: This SNP caused a T37K mutation in BRCA1, linked to various cancers including breast.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: The SNP rs5848 in the GRN gene was associated with neurodegenerative diseases, specifically linking it to Parkinson's disease in a Taiwanese population. This finding indicated a potential role of the GRN polymorphism in the pathology of neurodegenerative conditions, particularly relevant in the context of haploinsufficiency leading to diseases such as frontotemporal lobar degeneration, as evidenced by previous studies.
title: Progranulin deficiency leads to reduced glucocerebrosidase activity

finding: The SNP rs971292786-C was associated with levels of calcification in coronary arteries, showing a significant effect (β = 0.51, P-value = 1.9 × 10-7). Additionally, in a FinnGen PheWAS, it demonstrated an association with coronary angioplasty (β = 0.055, P-value = 4.10 × 10-5), reflecting a consistent direction of effect with the known pathology.
title: Self-supervised learning for characterising histomorphological diversity and spatial RNA expression prediction across 23 human tissue types

finding: The rs17886183 SNP, located in the 3'UTR of the SOST gene, was associated with higher bone mineral density (BMD) in a subset of postmenopausal women. The exploratory analysis indicated that individuals carrying the heterozygous mutation had a mean BMD of 0.889 g/cm² compared to 0.850 g/cm² in those with the reference allele, supporting the hypothesis that this variant contributes to differences in BMD.
title: Human-derived alleles in SOST and RUNX2 3′UTRs cause differential regulation in a bone cell-line model

finding: The missense mutation rs117190076 in the RPH3AL gene was identified as increasing the risk for late-onset Alzheimer’s disease. In the context of this study, RPH3AL was downregulated in the induced neurons (iNs) derived from people living with HIV (PLWH) compared to matched individuals without HIV (PWOH). The findings suggested a correlation between the downregulation of genes associated with neurotransmitter release and the cognitive impairments observed in PLWH.
title: A Transcriptional Signature of Induced Neurons Differentiates Virologically Suppressed People Living With HIV from People Without HIV

finding: This SNP exhibited significant allelic imbalance in multiple donors, showcasing its potential role in CAD as it was located in the promoter region affecting expression.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The splice site variant rs11078928 was associated with a genotype-dependent alteration in expression of GSDMB transcripts. This finding suggested a potential link between this SNP and variations in GSDMB expression, which could impact its roles in tumorigenesis.
title: IN VIVO ANALYSIS OF THE ROLE OF GASDERMIN-B (GSDMB) IN CANCER USING NOVEL KNOCK-IN MOUSE MODELS

finding: The analysis of rs8067378 polymorphism indicated its association with an increased risk of uterine cervical cancer in a Polish population. This polymorphism also impacted Gasdermin B expression, suggesting that variations in this SNP could influence cancer susceptibility.
title: IN VIVO ANALYSIS OF THE ROLE OF GASDERMIN-B (GSDMB) IN CANCER USING NOVEL KNOCK-IN MOUSE MODELS

finding: The SNP rs665835, designated as a Consensus SNP in the FCGR2A locus, was noted for its overlap with a microglia-specific enhancer. It has been shown to disrupt a SPI1 transcription factor binding motif, suggesting its involvement in PD-related mechanisms as well.
title: Fine-mapping of Parkinson’s disease susceptibility loci identifies putative causal variants

finding: The SNP rs8070063 was identified in the study by Mowday et al. (2016) as being significant in the context of advancing Clostridia for clinical trials in cancer therapy. This finding related to the potential use of <italic>C. sporogenes</italic> in tumor regression and highlighted its role in the aerotolerance introduced by the <italic>noxA</italic> gene, facilitating better survivability in oxidative environments associated with cancerous tissues.
title: Heterologous Expression of NoxA Confers Aerotolerance in Clostridium sporogenes

finding: Similarly, the rs80357971 BRCA1 frameshift variant was present in the germline of patient PD56542 within the BCAC cohort. This variant was also recognized as pathogenic by an expert panel in the ClinVar database (ClinVar Variant ID 17667), indicating a link to heightened susceptibility to breast and ovarian cancers that may extend to salivary gland tumours.
title: Activation of Wnt/β-catenin signalling by mutually exclusive FBXW11 and CTNNB1 hotspot mutations drives salivary gland basal cell adenoma

finding: The SNP rs10451283, located in the LINC02210-CRHR1 gene region, was linked with white matter characteristics and suggests a significant role in brain connectivity.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: Fine mapped variant rs9897399 in the LINC02210-CRHR1 region showed notable associations with white matter microstructural traits.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The SNP rs242561 in the MAPT locus demonstrated significant association with DTI parameters, suggesting it plays a role in white matter microstructure.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: Association analysis revealed that rs62062794 within MAPT was related to traits derived from white matter imaging, further elucidating genetic contributions.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: Fine mapping identified the SNP rs199510 linked with the WNT3 locus, correlating with variations in white matter microstructure.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: SNP rs70600 within the WNT3 gene was associated with DTI parameters, showing its relevance to the structure and function of white matter.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The SNP rs70602, also located in WNT3, demonstrated a significant association with DTI metrics, reinforcing its impact on white matter microstructure.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The SNP rs1109303 was identified as a significant PD risk variant that influenced the expression of SATB1. This regulation was found to control the expression of the microRNA MIR22HG, which plays a role in downregulating the expression of GBA, thereby influencing the pathway that leads to neuronal dysfunction associated with PD.
title: The SATB1-MIR22-GBA axis mediates glucocerebroside accumulation inducing a cellular senescence-like phenotype in dopaminergic neurons

finding: The study identified the rs74999341 SNP as significant due to its location in the 3' UTR of the SOX9 gene. The analysis utilized specific LNA probes for detecting the T-allele and C-allele variants of this SNP in cDNA derived from CNCCs. Findings indicated that variations at this SNP correlated with differences in SOX9 expression levels, thus linking the SNP to the molecular mechanisms underlying the regulation of SOX9 in Pierre Robin sequence (PRS) patients.
title: Structural elements facilitate extreme long-range gene regulation at a human disease locus

finding: The 461G>A variant (rs8178847) showed a slightly higher incidence in thrombosis cases, with a reported odds ratio of 1.55, indicating an association between this allele and thrombosis. A mild reduction in β2GPI levels was also noted among subjects with this haplotype.
title: Protection of β2GPI Deficient Mice from Thrombosis Reflects a Defect in PAR3-facilitated Platelet Activation

finding: The variant rs8078228 was associated with lifetime smoking and its effect on waist-hip ratio (WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>). This finding emphasizes the genetic influence of smoking behavior on body fat distribution.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs56750287 was identified as an eQTL for ORMDL3 in CD8+ T GZMKhi cells and also represented a variant in a trans-ancestry GWAS for rheumatoid arthritis, suggesting a connection to inflammatory diseases including childhood-onset asthma.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: The SNP rs5848 in the GRN gene was associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease. This finding was based on research that indicated how this variant could lead to reduced plasma and brain levels of granulin in patients with Alzheimer's disease, correlating with the pathological observations related to Grn deficiency.
title: Lysosomes cell autonomously regulate myeloid cell states and immune responses

finding: SNP rs34562254 in TNFRSF13B was specifically associated with SLE in Chinese populations (OR = 1.18, P = 2.88E-08), while it exhibited no significant association in Europeans (OR = 1.01, P = 0.75), highlighting its role in autoantibody production within this ancestry.
title: Identification of 38 novel loci for systemic lupus erythematosus and genetic heterogeneity that may underly population disparities in this disease

finding: The study found that the incidence of the homozygous mutant variant Pro/Pro (rs1042522) was significantly higher in esophageal cancer patients (20 out of 28, 71.4%) compared to healthy controls (1 out of 10, 10%), with a p-value of 0.0026.
title: Genetic analysis of TP53 gene mutations in exon 4 and exon 8 among esophageal cancer patients in Sudan

finding: The SNP rs63750959, corresponding to a non-synonymous variant p.Arg5His in the protein P10636, was annotated as reducing the ability of tau to promote microtubule assembly and promoting fibril formation in vitro. This finding related to Frontotemporal Dementia (FTD) and was supported by evidence from the literature.
title: eMIND: Enabling automatic collection of protein variation impacts in Alzheimer’s disease from the literature

finding: The rs1042522 polymorphism in the TP53 gene was investigated in relation to breast cancer phenotype and prognosis.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs744166 was found to be associated with increased tyrosine phosphorylation of STAT3 in IL-23 responsive innate lymphoid cells, highlighting its role in the pathogenesis of Crohn's Disease. This finding suggested a significant genetic influence in immune response mechanisms, which may relate to conditions like Alopecia areata.
title: Involvement of ILC1-like innate lymphocytes in human autoimmunity, lessons from alopecia areata

finding: The SNP rs8070069 was identified in a study that linked Wnt lipidation and modifiers to intestinal carcinogenesis and cancer. This finding underscored the role of fatty acid metabolism and FASN in cancer progression, suggesting that variant influence on fatty acid synthesis could modulate cancer susceptibility.
title: A bioorthogonal chemical reporter for fatty acid synthase-dependent protein acylation

finding: SNP rs76774446 was identified as one of three highly significant risk variants on chromosome 17 (OR: 1.60, p=9.95×10^-8) within the GOSR2 locus, associated with anomalies of thoracic arteries and veins (ATAV).
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs11874, located within the GOSR2 locus, also reached a significant association (OR: 1.60, p=6.64×10^-8) in patients with ATAV, suggesting its involvement in the condition.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: This SNP (rs17677363) within the GOSR2 locus showed significant association (OR: 1.60, p=9.81×10^-8) with ATAV, reinforcing the importance of this genetic region in heart vessel anomalies.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: SNP rs138741144 was significant for septal defects being located within the ASIC2 gene locus, suggesting its involvement in the development of this specific heart defect.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs4430796 was associated with prostate cancer (PCa) susceptibility at the 17q12/HNF1B locus. This locus specifically showed an enrichment of transcription factor genes and had been previously reported in multiple studies confirming its role in PCa risk.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: SNP rs11263763 was also found to be significantly associated with PCa risk at the 17q12/HNF1B locus, hence corroborating its involvement in the genetic predisposition to prostate cancer.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The variant rs11651052 demonstrated a significant association with susceptibility to PCa, reinforcing its status within the 17q12/HNF1B locus known for influencing cancer risk.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The SNP rs7405696 was highlighted as having enhancer function in regulating HNF1B expression, thus contributing to its role in PCa severity and progression.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: Similar to rs7405696, variant rs9901746 exhibited enhancer-like activity and was implicated in modulating HNF1B transcription, further associating it with PCa risk pathways.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The rs12453443 SNP was reported to function as an enhancer for HNF1B, which plays a key role in pathways relevant to prostate cancer pathogenesis and severity.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: SNP rs718960 was indicated as having significant chromatin enrichment correlating with PCa risk-associated transcription factors, marking its relevance in cancer predisposition studies.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The rs684232 SNP was linked to PCa susceptibility and showed co-occupancy with transcription factors HNF1B and ERG, enhancing its importance in the functional regulatory network.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The SNP rs2955626 functioned as an enhancer and was proven to regulate the expression of genes linked to PCa, demonstrating its critical role in cancer biology.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The variant rs461251 was actively engaged in enhancer activities for PCa-associated genes suggesting its intrinsic role in tumor progression mechanisms.
title: Extensive germline-somatic interplay drives prostate cancer through HNF1B co-option of TMPRSS2-ERG

finding: The SNP rs9891103 was the most significant locus for autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and was jointly associated with whole brainstem volume, with MAPT as the nearest gene.
title: The genetic architecture of human brainstem structures and their involvement in common brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs8070942 was identified as shared between ASD and SCZ, related to medulla oblongata volume, with KANSL1 as the nearest gene involved in gene expression in the brain.
title: The genetic architecture of human brainstem structures and their involvement in common brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs3865315 was shared between SCZ and medulla oblongata volume. The nearest gene for this SNP was also KANSL1.
title: The genetic architecture of human brainstem structures and their involvement in common brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs78378222[C] was associated with a moderate risk of several cancers, specifically showing increased susceptibility to soft tissue sarcoma (OR = 4.55, p = 3.3 x 10^-5) and brain tumors, while exhibiting a protective effect against breast cancer (OR = 0.573, p = 0.0078). This correlates with its role in Li-Fraumeni syndrome (LFS) mutant contexts and underlines a complex interaction where the minor allele leads to increased tumorigenesis in some tissues while reducing susceptibility in others.
title: Tissue-specific MicroRNA Expression Alters Cancer Susceptibility Conferred by a TP53 Noncoding Variant

finding: In the context of differential gene expression (DEG) analysis related to Alzheimer's disease (AD), rs2532404 was identified as an eQTL linked to KANSL1, a gene associated with neurodevelopmental defects and intellectual disability. This SNP was found in a linked peak that regulates KANSL1 expression in induced pluripotent stem cell-derived neurons, highlighting its significance in AD pathology.
title: Single nucleus multiomics identifies ZEB1 and MAFB as candidate regulators of Alzheimer’s disease-specific cis regulatory elements

finding: This variant was identified as having a significant association with the expression of the gene ORMDL3 and asthma susceptibility, corroborating its role as a causal variant influencing both ORMDL3 expression and asthma risk.
title: Multiple Causal Variants Underlie Genetic Associations in Humans

finding: The rs3027172 genotype was found to interact with early life stress to predict problematic alcohol use. However, it showed no significant relationship with reward-related ventral striatum activity.
title: The longitudinal stability of fMRI activation during reward processing in adolescents and young adults

finding: The SNP rs2009 was identified as part of the plasmid ars2-3358, linked with ARS activity, although its efficiency was slightly reduced compared to the original plasmid. This indicates its role in enabling DNA replication origins.
title: Characterization of DNA replicators of a 75-kb region of Chromosome 2 of fission yeast, Schizosacharomyces pombe

finding: The SNP rs11575895 was mentioned in association with multiple addiction-related traits, being part of the highly pleiotropic MAPT-CRHR1 locus. It was reported in perfect LD with another SNP (rs62056779) and was significant across 5 of the 7 addiction-associated traits.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: The SNP rs62056779, in perfect linkage with rs11575895, was significant in multiple addiction-related traits as part of the MAPT-CRHR1 locus. It reflected the complexity of SNP effects across different neuronal subtypes and brain regions.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: The variant rs228271 was identified as a significant conditional allele-specific effect (cASE) variant. It was predicted to affect the binding of transcription factors E2F1 and E2F4, which influence the expression of the gene PIP4K2B. The study found that the alternative allele led to higher activity in the absence of caffeine, correlating with higher PIP4K2B expression, which is associated with hypertension. However, in the presence of caffeine, the expression of E2F1 and E2F4 genes was downregulated, reducing the regulatory activity associated with rs228271 and suggesting that caffeine could mitigate genetic risk for hypertension in individuals with the AA genotype.
title: Characterization of caffeine response regulatory variants in vascular endothelial cells

finding: The SNP rs12946510 was recognized as a pleiotropic variant linked to Chronic Recurrent Dermatitis (CRD), Multiple Sclerosis (MS), and Ulcerative Colitis (ULC), underlining its role in the shared genetic risks of multiple AiDs.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs2305480 was associated with Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) and Ulcerative Colitis (ULC), indicating its involvement in genetic overlaps between autoimmune diseases.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs883770 was linked to Sjögren's syndrome (SSC) and highlighted non-pleiotropic SNPs contributing to autoimmune disease pathology.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs2290400 was associated with Type 1 Diabetes (TID) and was recognized for its role in the genetic architecture relating to autoimmune diseases.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs4643373 was associated with both insomnia symptoms and coronary artery disease (CAD), including myocardial infarction. A genome-wide association study showed that this SNP co-localized with insomnia symptoms and significantly influenced gene expression in multiple tissues, such as the left ventricle of the heart and the hypothalamus. Observational studies indicated that insomnia doubled the risk of incident cardiovascular disease (CVD), emphasizing the locus' relevance in understanding the genetic mechanisms linking insomnia and cardiac function.
title: Identifying novel links between cardiovascular disease and insomnia by Drosophila modeling of genes from a pleiotropic GWAS locus

finding: Associated with expression of TNFSF12 and had the strongest association with mean IAV reads (p = 1.3 x 10^-5), suggesting it may impact IAV susceptibility through gene expression.
title: Single-cell genome-wide association reveals a nonsynonymous variant in ERAP1 confers increased susceptibility to influenza virus

finding: Found to be strongly associated with expression of SLFN5, a gene induced by IAV infection, showing a significant association (uninfected 2-step FDR = 5.3 x 10^-140, IAV 2-step FDR = 1.3 x 10^-249).
title: Single-cell genome-wide association reveals a nonsynonymous variant in ERAP1 confers increased susceptibility to influenza virus

finding: The SNP rs12232535 located in the LOX12 gene was linked to the potentiation of IL-6 production in the in vitro BCG trained immunity model, with a significance level of p=0.00021 based on the assessment conducted on the same cohort.
title: Fatty acid desaturation and lipoxygenase pathways support trained immunity

finding: The SNP rs955461 in the LOX12 gene was associated with an increased fold change of IL-6 after BCG vaccination, showing significant results (p=0.00032) in the in vivo analysis.
title: Fatty acid desaturation and lipoxygenase pathways support trained immunity

finding: rs5819638 was linked to breast, prostate, and endometrial cancer risks, providing evidence for its protective role through BMD associations.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: This SNP affected TP53 expression levels and was associated with different cancer risks, illustrating the complex interactions between germline and somatic mutations.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: SNP rs1805462 was identified in association with the differential expression of eQTL genes between human and macaque lymphoblastoid cell lines (LCLs), indicating its role in <italic>trans</italic> regulation. Further analyses highlighted its correlations with variation in blood traits.
title: Human gene regulatory evolution is driven by the divergence of regulatory element function in both cis and trans

finding: The rs9730 missense variant in ARHGAP27 was associated with increased number of children ever born, yet it was also linked to a shorter reproductive lifespan, indicating a trade-off in reproductive strategies.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies genetic effects on reproductive success and ongoing natural selection at the FADS locus

finding: The rs12939435 variant was associated with significant changes in 5mC levels at the CD300A locus, depending on the proportion of CD8+ T cells. The analysis indicated a strong interaction effect with a confidence interval of CI: [-0.50%, -0.29%] and P_adj = 2.19×10^-14. CD300A has implications in immunomodulatory functions.
title: Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: The variant rs11653735 within the CSNK1D gene was significantly associated with urea levels (p-value 2.08e-10), with replication in meta-analysis. CSNK1D is involved in ciliogenesis and its association was novel, highlighting its potential regulatory roles.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: This SNP was identified as a cis-eQTL controlling IKZF3 expression in whole blood and EBV-transformed lymphocytes, and was previously associated with asthma and autoimmune diseases.
title: Vitamin D constrains inflammation by modulating the expression of key genes on Chr17q12-21.1

finding: This SNP was a cis-eQTL controlling IKZF3 expression and was associated with autoimmune diseases, implicating it in the pathogenesis of these conditions.
title: Vitamin D constrains inflammation by modulating the expression of key genes on Chr17q12-21.1

finding: This SNP influenced the expression of ORMDL3 and was previously associated with both asthma and autoimmune diseases, thus linking it to vitamin D signaling effects on immune responses.
title: Vitamin D constrains inflammation by modulating the expression of key genes on Chr17q12-21.1

finding: The homozygous variant in TSPOAP1 (p.Gly1808Ser) was identified in the proband and other affected siblings, predicted pathogenic by in silico tools, with a significant CADD score of 27.7. This variant was directly linked to the presentation of adult-onset focal dystonia.
title: Bi-allelic variants in TSPOAP1, encoding the active zone protein RIMBP1, cause autosomal recessive dystonia

finding: The SNP rs2008012 showed a hyperoxia-specific association with the expression of H3F3B in immature excitatory neurons, which was distinct from its oxygen-insensitive effect observed in dividing intermediate progenitors. Additionally, this SNP was linked to variations in uncinate fasciculus white matter and implicated in the regulation of multiple genes, including TRIM47, TRIM65, WBP2, and ACOX1, suggesting its role in both structural and regulatory functions related to microstructural brain features.
title: Oxygen-induced stress reveals context-specific gene regulatory effects in human brain organoids

finding: The SNP rs12453010 was identified in an intergenic region on chromosome 17 and was the most significantly associated with neck or shoulder pain in the UK Biobank cohort, with a P value of 1.66 × 10^-11. However, this locus was not replicated in the GS:SFHS or TwinsUK cohorts.
title: A genome-wide association study finds genetic variants associated with neck or shoulder pain in UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs315506, located on chr17q11.2, was significantly associated with the spatial distribution of endoplasmic reticulum (ER) in the cytoplasm, particularly affecting the Cytoplasm_RadialDistribution_RadialCV_ER_3of4 trait in colonies. The minor allele frequency (MAF) was 0.08, with an effect size of -0.52 (se 0.08) and a P-value of 1.4×10^-10. This association indicated potential links to NF1 microdeletion syndrome, which affects protein localization to the ER.
title: High-dimensional phenotyping to define the genetic basis of cellular morphology

finding: The SNP rs11871958 was associated with alternative splicing of the SNHG29 gene, correlating with AATF expression and influencing the PSI of an intron junction. It highlighted the potential role of SNHG29 in OA pathogenesis.
