finding: Mohtavinejad et al. found an association between CCL5 gene polymorphism rs2107538 and the risk of cardiovascular disease in a study published in 2021.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: CCL2 rs3760396 gene polymorphism was associated with the risk of cardiovascular disease, as detailed by Mohtavinejad et al. in 2021.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The polymorphism IKZF3 rs12946510 was linked to multiple sclerosis onset and severity in the study conducted by Stefanovic et al. in 2020.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs13900 in MCP1 showed significant variation and opposing major alleles between the Memphis and Nicaragua cohorts, indicating genetic differences in immune-related genes with functional implications due to ancestry.
title: Integrated Drivers of Basal and Acute Immunity in Diverse Human Populations

finding: In cytokine models, rs5027581 had significant effects on Eotaxin levels, with genetic components including herpesvirus interactions influencing the model's performance.
title: Integrated Drivers of Basal and Acute Immunity in Diverse Human Populations

finding: Association of the CCL5 rs2107538 gene polymorphism with the risk of cardiovascular disease was established, thus potentially influencing the pathways involved in metabolic diseases.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: The rs3760396 polymorphism in the CCL2 gene was identified as being associated with cardiovascular disease risk, indicating its role in inflammatory pathways relevant to NAFLD.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs7212798 related to BCAS3 was supported as an eQTL, consistent with original GWAS findings.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The SNP rs11650008 was identified as the most significantly associated SNP with ALS in the region of the GGNBP2 gene, with a p-value of 8.6x10^-8. This SNP was originally found in a cross-ancestry GWAS involving 13,811 sporadic ALS cases and 26,350 controls, and its association was confirmed in a larger study with 29,612 sporadic cases and 122,656 controls. Gene-based tests indicated that GGNBP2 was the most significantly associated gene in the region (p = 6.6x10^-7). The analysis established that GGNBP2 showed the largest changes in gene expression between risk and non-risk alleles, reinforcing its role as a top candidate risk gene for ALS.
title: Ggnbp2 regulates synaptic development and autophagy in motor neurons

finding: The T allele of rs12948220 exhibited a significant positive correlation with the expression of TRPV3 specifically in one chondrocyte subtype, illustrating a potential cell-type specific eQTL effect.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The genetic study by Alshammary et al. (2023) reported that the rs2107538 variant in the CCL5 gene was associated with Saudi patients diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus. This finding indicated a link between the genetic variant and the inflammatory processes involved in type 2 diabetes, suggesting that this SNP may play a role in the exacerbation of comorbidities linked to chronic inflammation, such as intervertebral disc degeneration.
title: Secreted chemokines reveal diverse inflammatory and degenerative processes in the intervertebral disc of the STZ-HFD mouse model of Type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs3936197 was associated with white blood cell count, having a p-value of 5.18e-289 and a beta value of -0.0772. It represented a population-enriched risk variant identified in the meta-analysis.
title: Low generalizability of polygenic scores in African populations due to genetic and environmental diversity

finding: Associated with an anteromedial temporal area on chromosome 17q21.31, this SNP was the most significant in the GWAS for global analysis (GWAS<italic>g+r</italic>), showing an impressive p-value of 1.33e-61 and explaining 0.84% of the variance.
title: Larger cerebral cortex is genetically correlated with greater frontal area and dorsal thickness

finding: This SNP was linked to total surface area and located on chromosome 17q21.31, presenting a strong signal in GWAS<italic>g</italic> with a p-value of 4.94e-33 while explaining 0.44% of the variance.
title: Larger cerebral cortex is genetically correlated with greater frontal area and dorsal thickness

finding: The rs5848 variant of the GRN gene was associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). In this study, the finding highlighted that the T allele of rs5848 was linked with exacerbated disinhibited behaviors and increased tau inclusions in PS19 mice with PGRN reduction. This contrasted with prior studies that reported a lack of significant effects from PGRN haploinsufficiency in animal models, leading researchers to suggest that the behaviors and pathologies observed were directly influenced by reduced GCase activity following PGRN reduction.
title: Reduced progranulin increases tau and α-synuclein inclusions and alters phenotypes of tauopathy mice via glucocerebrosidase

finding: The SNP rs2269906 was identified as an independent risk variant located in the novel multi-signal locus involving the genes UBTF and GRN. This locus contributed to the understanding of genetic factors associated with Parkinson's disease (PD) risk.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The SNP rs850738 was also found in the novel multi-signal locus alongside rs2269906. It was identified as a risk signal associated with Parkinson's disease, with the nearest putatively causal gene being GRN, which is connected to frontotemporal dementia.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The SNP rs676387 was located within HSD17B1 and was identified as a novel locus related to eczema, demonstrating significant associations.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs112677036 was noted as interacting with the IKZF3 promoter and additional distant promoters of the genes PGAP3 and ERBB2, thus implicating it in regulatory mechanisms affecting T follicular helper (TFH) cells relevant to systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: The SNP rs71368520 was found to interact with MINK1, another gene implicated in the regulation of TFH biology and SLE disease mechanisms.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: This SNP was similarly associated with MINK1, adding to the potential therapeutic targets within the pathways affected in SLE.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: SNP rs2071214 in the BIRC5 gene was associated with intracerebral hemorrhage in the Korean population, suggesting its significance in stroke-related conditions.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The SNP rs17651213 was identified as a modulator of MAPT isoform expression, influencing susceptibility to neurodegenerative diseases (NDD), particularly for carriers of the H1 haplotype, which was linked to increased vulnerability to Mild Chronic Oxidative Stress (MCOS) and subsequent cell death through ferroptosis.
title: Rescue of the increased susceptibility to Mild Chronic Oxidative Stress of iNeurons carrying the MAPT Chromosome 17q21.3 H1/H1 risk allele by FDA-approved compounds

finding: Similar to rs17651213, rs1800547 was proven to regulate haplotype-specific splicing of MAPT isoforms, affecting the risk of NDD in individuals with the H1 haplotype that exhibited greater susceptibility to MCOS and ferroptosis.
title: Rescue of the increased susceptibility to Mild Chronic Oxidative Stress of iNeurons carrying the MAPT Chromosome 17q21.3 H1/H1 risk allele by FDA-approved compounds

finding: The SNP rs242561 was associated with differential expression at the MAPT locus and played a role in the increased neurodegenerative risk seen with the H1 haplotype, which was more susceptible to MCOS-induced cell death.
title: Rescue of the increased susceptibility to Mild Chronic Oxidative Stress of iNeurons carrying the MAPT Chromosome 17q21.3 H1/H1 risk allele by FDA-approved compounds

finding: The polymorphism of SREBF1 gene rs11868035 G/A demonstrated an association with susceptibility to Parkinson's disease in a Chinese population, indicating its potential role as a biomarker.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis to identify key genes and pathways influencing in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs882380 at the 17q21.32 risk locus was identified as one of the top eQTLs for the HiChIP target genes SNX11 and HOXB2, suggesting its role in endometrial cancer risk variation.
title: Analysis of promoter-associated chromatin interactions reveals biologically relevant candidate target genes at endometrial cancer risk loci

finding: The variant rs7207591 located in an LD block for allergy-associated variants colocalized with a STAT5A eQTL, demonstrating its regulatory effects on Treg function, particularly in pathways downstream of the IL-2 receptor.
title: Immune disease variants modulate gene expression in regulatory CD4+ T cells and inform drug targets

finding: RS34129849 was noted within the LD region of allergy-associated variants and mapped to an open chromatin region in the STAT5B gene, further supporting its role in modulating Treg function via STAT pathway interactions.
title: Immune disease variants modulate gene expression in regulatory CD4+ T cells and inform drug targets

finding: The SNP rs72815409 was part of the FDA5 PRS, which significantly correlated with weight-for-length/height ratios across time and was associated with children exhibiting rapid infant weight gain. It was noted as downstream of SHISA6, which is related to insulin sensitivity.
title: Polygenic risk score based on weight gain trajectories is predictive of childhood obesity

finding: rs12948076 was significantly associated with nasal features, particularly the nasal tip's prominence. A alleles were linked to a higher nasal tip, affecting the length and height of the nose (p = 7.41 × 10−9). Candidate genes SOX9 and CASC17 were associated with these nasal traits.
title: Genome-wide Association study of facial morphology identifies novel genetic loci in Han Chinese

finding: A significant finding related to the rs25531 SNP was that the L<sub>G</sub> allele, which is the minor L allele with a G substitution, exhibited lower promoter activity compared to the major L allele with an A substitution. This finding was important in understanding the variability of the SLC6A4 gene expression related to different 5-HTTLPR genotypes.
title: Promoter activity-based case-control association study on SLC6A4 highlighting hypermethylation and altered amygdala volume in male patients with schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs12947788 was identified as heterozygous in parental HCT116 cells, where it exhibited C or T alleles. This SNP was utilized to confirm biallelic modification during the UKiS mutagenesis process, specifically indicating the successful introduction of puromycin and blasticidin versions associated with each allele.
title: Biallelic and gene-wide genomic substitution for endogenous intron and retroelement mutagenesis in human cells

finding: The SNP rs1641548 was discovered in the iPS cell line 201B7 where it was heterozygous (A or G). Direct sequencing provided evidence of biallelic substitution at this SNP during the UKiS process, confirming the successful deletion of the TP53 intron at both alleles in the tested iPS clones.
title: Biallelic and gene-wide genomic substitution for endogenous intron and retroelement mutagenesis in human cells

finding: This missense variant in <italic>KANSL1</italic> was tied to simple processing speed and was also identified as an eQTL influencing expression in the cerebellum, relevant for cognitive processing.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The missense variant rs750623950 (p.Arg112Trp) in CD300LG was associated in FinMetSeq with an increase in HDL-C of 0.95 mmol/l, indicating its role in lipid profiles.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The SNP rs121918673 was identified within the significant genomic region linked to type 2 diabetes and was associated with genotype-specific risks in the context of the gene HNF1B. This was relevant to understanding the genetic basis connecting type 2 diabetes to cataract.
title: The putative causal effect of type 2 diabetes in risk of cataract: a Mendelian randomization study in East Asian

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs1555818071, also located within the gene HNF1B, was identified in the context of significant genomic regions associated with type 2 diabetes. Its findings contributed to elucidating the shared genetic factors linked to the risk of cataract as influenced by type 2 diabetes.
title: The putative causal effect of type 2 diabetes in risk of cataract: a Mendelian randomization study in East Asian

finding: SNP rs9913698, located in the 3' UTR of the CD300LF gene, was identified in the Peruvian cohort as being under selection with an AdaptMix P-value of 3.11×10^-9, linked to immune homeostasis and various white blood cell counts.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: SNP rs36102671, although not reaching statistical significance upon multiple testing correction, was associated with decreased L:M cone ratio and located within the first intron of the RARA gene, which encodes a retinoic acid receptor. The minor (A) allele was less common globally and showed significant linkage disequilibrium with nearby genes, suggesting its potential influence on cone subtype development regardless of the lack of robustness in the findings.
title: Temporal regulation of green and red cone specification in human retinas and retinal organoids

finding: In the context of body mass index (BMI), the SNP rs7217403 was identified as a novel lead SNP using the LOG-TRAM method applied to the GWAS summary statistics of Biobank Japan (BBJ) and UK Biobank (UKBB). This SNP was associated with significantly enriched local heritability, showing 6.47 fold enrichment in East Asians (EAS) and 12.8 fold enrichment in Europeans (EUR). Although located in an intergenic region, rs7217403 maps near the gene MAP2K3, which has been reported to correlate with BMI across diverse populations. Replication studies demonstrated highly consistent effect sizes for rs7217403 with additional datasets, confirming its potential role as a reproducible obesity locus.
title: Leveraging the local genetic structure for trans-ancestry association mapping

finding: The SNP rs792399 was intronic to MSI2, and along with rs556874 and rs1449292, it significantly influenced lung function outcomes in SSc, forming what was referred to as the 'Wnt subnetwork'.
title: Genetic interactions affect lung function in patients with systemic sclerosis

finding: The CCL5 gene variant rs2107538 was associated with diabetes in Saudi patients, indicating its potential influence on kidney function or disease susceptibility in this cohort.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs847687 was associated with increased binding of the activating TF EOMES, which correlated with increased expression of the SGCA gene. This SNP was also linked to a disease risk locus associated with the vertical cup-disc ratio phenotype, indicating a role for EOMES in transcriptional regulation pertinent to this trait.
title: Quantitative assessment of association between noncoding variants and transcription factor binding

finding: Identified as significantly associated with tumor grade (P=1.70×10⁻⁴).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs2586434 was associated with TCEA1, a gene involved in DNA binding, in a subset of B cells, indicating its role as a trans-eQTL.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs869402, located in the fourth haplotype block of the 17q12-21 locus, exhibited a statistically significant association with asthma (p = 5.35e-04). This finding was consistent when considering asthmatic individuals with onset ages younger than 17 years (p = 1.73e-04), highlighting its relevance in the genetic predisposition to asthma.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: The SNP rs9303281, situated in the fifth haplotype block at the 17q12-21 locus, also demonstrated strong statistical significance in association with asthma (p = 2.60e-04) alongside its continued relevance in younger asthmatics (p = 2.01e-04). This suggests its involvement in the pathways linking genotype to asthma phenotype.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: SNP rs7216389 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) affecting the expression of ORMDL3. This association contributed to the understanding of genetic influences on asthma, particularly in immune cell functions.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: The SNP rs2290400 was also determined to be an eQTL associated with ORMDL3 expression. This relationship provided further insights into how genetic variants could mediate asthma risk through regulatory mechanisms.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: SNP rs4795405 was implicated as an eQTL influencing the expression of ORMDL3, contributing to the understanding of genetic variability linked to asthma pathophysiology.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: The SNP rs4065275 was identified as a methylation quantitative trait locus (mQTL) affecting DNA methylation within the 1.5 kb region from the ORMDL3 transcription start site. This finding underscored the link between genetic variation and epigenetic regulation in the context of asthma.
title: GSDMA drives the most replicated association with asthma in naïve CD4+ T cells

finding: Marker rs10560 was identified at 75.83 cM for resistance to the PKTTS race. It is near the marker IWA3756, suggesting a potential association with previously identified QTLs related to this resistance.
title: Identification of novel leaf rust seedling resistance loci in Iranian bread wheat germplasm using genome-wide association mapping

finding: The tag-variant rs74001624 was significantly associated with lower levels of expression of the SECTM1 gene. This finding was relevant in the context of hematopoietic processes and supported evidence from genome-wide association studies.
title: Resolving the insertion sites of polymorphic duplications reveals a HERC2 haplotype under selection

finding: The SNP rs149582052 showed a significant expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) relationship with the gene PKCRA, indicating that variations in this SNP were associated with changes in PKCRA expression levels. This finding derived from the analyses conducted on iPSC-cardiomyocytes (iPSC-CMs) which were differentiated from a multiethnic cohort, thus providing insights into genetic influences on cardiac health.
title: A Resource of Gene Expression Data from a Multiethnic Population Cohort of Induced Pluripotent Cell–Derived Cardiomyocytes

finding: The rs113373052 variant in FN3K/FN3KRP was confirmed as associated with HbA1c, emphasizing its relevance in erythrocytic traits influencing HbA1c diagnostics.
title: Impact of rare and common genetic variants on diabetes diagnosis by hemoglobin A1c in multi-ancestry cohorts: The Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine Program

finding: The variant rs1046896 was verified as part of the FN3K/FN3KRP association with HbA1c, thereby contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on HbA1c.
title: Impact of rare and common genetic variants on diabetes diagnosis by hemoglobin A1c in multi-ancestry cohorts: The Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine Program

finding: The rs62621401 variant, SPATA20<K422R</sub>, was identified as a rare novel locus specifically associated with arm fat mass, showing a significant decrease in arm fat mass (β = -0.29, p = 1.5E-11). This variant indicated a large effect size, with an estimated decrease of 125g in arm fat for men and 67g for women per allele.
title: Regional fat depot masses are influenced by protein-coding gene variants

finding: The SNP rs227727 was linked to the C17orf67 locus in the creatinine GWAS and exhibited significant ATAC-seq signals, particularly in type II muscle fibers. This SNP was identified as having a 76.6% probability of being causal for creatinine levels, influencing gene regulatory elements.
title: Human and rat skeletal muscle single-nuclei multi-omic integrative analyses nominate causal cell types, regulatory elements, and SNPs for complex traits

finding: The SNP rs242557, located in the MAPT locus, was associated with PART at a significance level of 0.02, highlighting the intersection of genetic predisposition between PART and progressive supranuclear palsy.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: The SNP rs2874164, a T/C variant located in the intronic DRB1 motif, was previously identified as having a significant impact on gene expression after IFNγ stimulation. Specifically, the presence of the C allele in DRB1*01 and DRB1*04, compared to the T allele in DRB1*03, suggested that this SNP may influence the transcriptional responses in the context of immune activation.
title: BCL6 regulates the endothelial pro-immunogenic phenotype relevant to organ transplant rejection

finding: The rs111902263 missense variant within the RNF135 gene was associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) in a French cohort. The study found a significantly increased frequency of genotypes carrying the rare allele of this variant in patients with ASD, highlighting the importance of the ubiquitin pathway in the aetiology of autism. Additionally, RNF135 was identified as a promising candidate gene in ASD through new developments in empirical Bayes scan statistics.
title: Autoencoder-transformed transcriptome improves genotype-phenotype association studies

finding: This SNP was linked to PEMT and indicated a possible transcription regulatory function based on its chromatin state in adipose tissue.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2189301 was labeled as 'shared' at the HNF1B locus where its associated credible variants showed similar scores in both islet and liver.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs5848 was associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease as reported by Sheng et al. in 2014. Furthermore, it was found by Kamalainen et al. in 2013 that this GRN variant rs5848 resulted in reduced plasma and brain levels of granulin in Alzheimer's disease patients, indicating its significant role in the disease's pathology.
title: Progranulin inhibits phospholipase sPLA2-IIA to control neuroinflammation

finding: This SNP played a significant role in regulatory mechanisms at the SOX9 locus, linked to craniofacial abnormalities.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: Similar to rs56407236, the original study highlighted TSOAP1 as the closest gene for rs2526377, but the new analysis found TRIM37 to be more closely associated due to significant eQTLs in blood.
title: snpXplorer: a web application to explore human SNP-associations and annotate SNP-sets

finding: The SNP rs8070060 was associated with the regulation of Wnt signaling pathways in cancer stem cell biology, as discussed in the context of the study by de Sousa and Vermeulen (2016). This showed relevance in the transcriptional regulation of chemoresistant Cancer Stem-Like Cells (CSLCs) found in metastatic breast cancer.
title: Identification and Pharmacological Targeting of Treatment-Resistant, Stem-like Breast Cancer Cells for Combination Therapy

finding: The polymorphism in the SREBF1 gene rs11868035 was associated with susceptibility to Parkinson's disease in a Chinese population.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This protective SNP was associated with an increase in BECN1 expression, linking it to autophagy initiation pathways and suggesting a regulatory role in PD biology.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs5848 was associated with neurodegenerative diseases, particularly frontotemporal dementia (FTD). It was demonstrated that this polymorphism led to a reduction in serum progranulin levels. Further studies indicated that the rs5848 variant significantly decreased plasma and brain levels of granulin in Alzheimer's disease patients. These findings provided evidence linking the rs5848 variant to decreased PGRN levels, contributing to the mechanisms underlying neurodegeneration in conditions such as FTD.
title: Frontotemporal Dementia Patient Neurons With Progranulin Deficiency Display Protein Dyshomeostasis

finding: The study indicated that the <italic>MAPT</italic> haplotype was associated with cognitive impairment in subjects with primary age-related tauopathy (PART), as it utilized the rs8070723 H2 tagging SNP. This finding highlighted the importance of genetic factors, particularly the <italic>MAPT</italic> locus, in understanding the cognitive outcomes in tauopathies.
title: Predictors of cognitive impairment in primary age-related tauopathy: an autopsy study

finding: The SNP rs4600514, identified as a missense variant leading to potentially damaging consequences, was implicated as a top genetic risk factor for white matter hyperintensity (WMH) formation. The mutation affected the function of TRIM47, a gene crucial for autophagy regulation in brain endothelial cells.
title: White matter hyperintensity genetic risk factor TRIM47 regulates autophagy in brain endothelial cells

finding: The S209F variant (rs616338:p.Ser209Phe) of ABI3 was found to significantly increase the risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD) with an odds ratio of 1.43 and a p-value of 4.5×10^-10. The minor allele frequency was reported as 0.008. This variant's association with AD risk was validated in a secondary study.
title: Deletion of Abi3/Gngt2 influences age-progressive amyloid β and tau pathologies in distinctive ways

finding: The rs1024611 polymorphism in the CCL2 cis-regulatory region was identified as a risk allele (G) associated with increased CCL2 expression, higher macrophage recruitment, and progression to HIV-associated dementia. It was also linked to a range of diseases including myocardial infarction, lupus nephritis, and Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Functional characterization of the disease-associated CCL2 rs1024611G-rs13900T haplotype: The role of the RNA-binding protein HuR

finding: The rs13900 SNP was shown to be in perfect LD with rs1024611 and associated with allelic expression imbalance (AEI) of CCL2. The T allele conferred increased stability and translatability of CCL2 mRNA, enhancing its expression influenced by the RNA-binding protein HuR.
title: Functional characterization of the disease-associated CCL2 rs1024611G-rs13900T haplotype: The role of the RNA-binding protein HuR

finding: The variants TP53 rs1042522 were associated with myocardial infarction, indicating a potential role in the disease pathogenesis.
title: Identification and Interaction Analysis of Molecular Markers in Myocardial Infarction by Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The variants TP53 rs8064946 were also associated with myocardial infarction, signifying their involvement in the disease process.
title: Identification and Interaction Analysis of Molecular Markers in Myocardial Infarction by Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The analysis identified that rs7221217 was one of the six mismatches to the reference genome in aligned reads, indicating its role in the chromatin accessibility of the promoter region of RNF135. Subjects of African ancestry demonstrated higher accessibility of this region compared to those of European ancestry.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: Similar to rs7221217, rs7221238 contributed to mismatches in the reference genome, correlating with increased chromatin accessibility in the RNF135 promoter region among individuals of African ancestry.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: Findings indicated that rs7219775 was part of the set of mismatches linked to the RNF135 accessibility variations, showing a trend of increased accessibility in African ancestry individuals.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: The rs7221473 SNP was also identified among the mismatches, contributing to the differential accessibility of the RNF135 promoter in individuals based on ancestry.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: This SNP was included in the mismatches that affected the chromatin accessibility at RNF135, highlighting its potential influence in the ancestry-specific patterns observed.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: Lastly, rs7211440 was part of the identified mismatches, underscoring its relevance to the chromatin accessibility differences in the RNF135 promoter region between ancestries.
title: Disease related changes in ATAC-Seq of more than 450 iPSC-derived motor neuron lines from ALS patients and controls

finding: The SNP rs145053802 located in the PER1 gene was associated with suicide death, marking it as one of the novel, rare SNPs identified in this study. The gene has additional evidence linking it with bipolar disorder, enhancing its relevance to suicide risk.
title: Rare protein coding variants implicate genes involved in risk of suicide death

finding: This SNP was linked to several CD-associated CpGs in the analysis, contributing to a total of 4 cis associations with significant findings.
title: Methylation Quantitative Trait Loci are Largely Consistent across Disease States in Crohn’s disease

finding: The rs55974014 SNP was associated with various traits including mood swings, neuroticism, and educational attainment. It was linked to neurological functions through its position near the CRHR1 and NSF genes.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 48 common genetic variants associated with handedness

finding: At the 17q12 locus, each copy of the risk allele (rs4795399) was associated with an average earlier onset of 2.29 years compared to individuals without the risk allele, with a significant p-value of 6.76×10^-65. This suggested a substantial association with age of asthma onset.
title: Shared and Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for Childhood Onset and Adult Onset Asthma: Genome- and Transcriptome-wide Studies

finding: The rs2302189 variant was linked to cognitive function.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The CCL2 rs1024611 gene polymorphism was found to be associated with variations in CCL2 levels, which have implications for neuroinflammation and neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. This SNP was discussed in the context of its role in myeloproliferative neoplasms, indicating its potential relevance in broader inflammatory processes.
title: CCL2 and Neuronal Inflammation: Implications for Neurodegenerative Diseases

finding: The SNP rs25531 in the SLC6A4 gene was determined to influence susceptibility and severity of cancer-related fatigue in colorectal cancer patients, establishing a connection between the SNP and cancer progression.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs769427 (c.853C>T, p.Pro285Ser) in the OR1A1 receptor was likely to alter the detection of citronellic terpenoid substances, indicating a possible change in olfactory signaling due to the substitution.
title: The mutational landscape of human olfactory G protein-coupled receptors

finding: The variant rs2297518 in the NOS2 gene was associated with increased NO production and had been linked to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), which includes both Crohn's disease (CD) and ulcerative colitis (UC). This finding highlighted the role of NOS2 in contributing to the pathophysiology of IBD.
title: A Specialized Epithelial Cell Type Regulating Mucosal Immunity and Driving Human Crohn’s Disease

finding: The SNP <italic>rs7224610</italic> at the <italic>HLF</italic> locus had significant evidence suggesting its involvement in serum urate regulation.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control
